SUcXTG82pMmewpem.name: Metal Allergy
SUcXTG82pMmewpem.description: When a magnegor takes damage from a metal weapon or an effect with the metal trait, it takes @Damage[5[untyped]] additional damage and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The value of the sickened condition increases each time the magnegor fails such a check, to a maximum of 3.

CJ589AJOrRrFopWl.name: Excavating Spines
CJ589AJOrRrFopWl.description: The magnegor inadvertently digs a 10-foot-deep continuous trench in any square it Wallows through, as long as the ground in that space isn't made of stone, rock, or some other surface too hard to excavate. The trench is greater difficult terrain. At the GM's discretion, any excavated square can reveal a deposit of sedimentary rock filled with metal ore that has Hardness 7 and 28 Hit Points.

umjew4vPAU8Ye3xs.name: Magnetized Coat
umjew4vPAU8Ye3xs.description: When a magnegor comes within 30 feet of a metal object or a deposit of metal ore, its thousands of wiry hairs stand on end, pointing towards the metal and creating a magnetic field. Metal items of light or negligible Bulk that touch the magnegor's coat adhere to it magnetically, requiring an Interact action to be pried free. Creatures wearing or primarily composed of metal treat all squares in a 10-foot radius around the magnegor as difficult terrain, unless they are moving directly towards it.

xsHOUZyFnSvFmKSt.name: Wallow
xsHOUZyFnSvFmKSt.description:
Requirements The magnegor is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The magnegor rolls on its spine-covered back, up to its Speed, furrowing the earth and crushing any Large or smaller creatures in its path. This deals @Damage[4d10[piercing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save; on a failed save, a creature wearing metal armor or made of metal is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the magnegor's magnetized coat (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 24). For each metal object or piece of equipment a restrained creature chooses to leave stuck to the magnegor, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its attempts to Escape. A creature that relinquishes all its metal Escapes automatically. The magnegor can move at its full Speed while it has a creature restrained in this way, bringing the creature along.

Stonefish.name: Stonefish
Stonefish.description: Stonefish use their superior camouflage to lie in wait and devour small prey, becoming indistinguishable from the reefs they call home. Larger creatures are also at risk, although mostly through accidental contact with the stonefish's spines and their agonizing venom.

NEFPwQtJW3PaG1vO.name: Camouflage
NEFPwQtJW3PaG1vO.description: The stonefish can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in its natural environment even if it doesn't have cover.

1f2PgrJfd3BP5KWT.name: Defensive Spines
1f2PgrJfd3BP5KWT.description: When a creature moves into a space with one or more stonefish, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish venom.

u2l5vP3881zLQeZt.name: Stonefish Venom
u2l5vP3881zLQeZt.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 3 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and clumsy 2 (1 hour)

Flynkett.name: Flynkett
Flynkett.description:
The piercing whistle of the flynkett can often be heard over the harsh jungle rains, shrieking dissonantly when its cries combine with others of its pack. Although generally effective as a warning to nearby predators, these sharp cries also serve as a lure for reckless alchemists eager to study the creature's potent enzymes.

Flynketts' name, most theorize, is a corruption of "flinging kettle" or "flying kettle." They can't truly fly, instead using their skin flaps to glide in a manner similar to flying squirrels. However, the primary use of their skin flaps isn't for movement, but digestion. When it rains, flynketts roll up their loose skin, creating a crude sort of kettle in which to catch precipitation. The remarkable creatures' acid combines with the falling water to break down wood, soil, or even rocks into a nutritional stew. Therefore, the flynkett can flourish when introduced to any environment with frequent rain, something solid to stand on, and a lack of natural predators.

Although their acid can be harvested without harming a flynkett, the creatures rarely cooperate. If disturbed, particularly in the middle of feeding, they release clouds of acidic steam. They're also capable of spitting the fluid with deadly accuracy. Thankfully for those who run afoul of them, flynketts have no use for corpses and will generally break off pursuit when the interloper leaves their territory.

Several organizations and individual scholars have desperately sought to domesticate flynketts for use in alchemical production. To date, none of these efforts have been successful, though several abandoned labs still contain aggressive packs of flynketts who protect their new territory with ferocious tenacity.

6YnIhpOQ5MuJkq7l.name: Glide
6YnIhpOQ5MuJkq7l.description: The flynkett stretches its flaps to glide through the air. It moves 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air. The flynkett can remain in the air long as it spends at least 1 action Gliding each round and does not Kettle Up.

iUhS0qcMQrvdqAug.name: Kettle Up
iUhS0qcMQrvdqAug.description: The flynkett uses its skin flaps to form a crude kettle. While Kettled Up, the flynkett can't use its claw Strike or take move actions. If the flynkett has been Kettled Up for 1 minute or longer, and its kettle is full of water (usually due to the flynkett being in the rain), the flynkett's kettle begins to boil, emitting a piercing whistle that causes all creatures within 30 feet to take a â€“2 penalty to Perception checks to hear sources other than the flynkett; this is an auditory effect. The flynkett can stop Kettling Up as a free action.

bTPVUFyH1OjjS4CW.name: Spill
bTPVUFyH1OjjS4CW.description:
Requirements The flynkett is Kettled Up

Trigger The flynkett takes physical damage or is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The flynkett spills the contents of its full skin flaps, releasing its digestive juices in a cloud of acidic vapor that deals @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage to all non-flynkett creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save). If the flynkett was boiling, the damage is increased to @Damage[4d8[acid]].

VnbrHdn59w08ioYl.name: Burrowing Retreat
VnbrHdn59w08ioYl.description:
Trigger The hardhead mole is hit by a Strike

Effect The hardhead mole immediately Burrows to a burrow hole if there is one within 20 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

ldi5ToHOl7d3DIEZ.name: Shovel Earth
ldi5ToHOl7d3DIEZ.description: The hardhead mole leaves a burrow hole in its square or an adjacent square. The square becomes difficult terrain but can be flattened back into normal terrain with an Interact action.

lwcZ0Yi0pF8c0wnM.name: Unbalancing Burrow
lwcZ0Yi0pF8c0wnM.description: The hardhead mole Burrows up to 20 feet in a straight line, displacing the earth on the surface. Any creature it passes through takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. This creates a burrow hole at the beginning and end of the line.

WpApOWeV9Yy8hi6U.name: Skymetal Metamorphosis
WpApOWeV9Yy8hi6U.description:
Each stargut hydra has at least one metamorphosis resulting from consuming a specific skymetal and internalizing its properties. If you give a stargut hydra more than one metamorphosis, you should consider increasing its level and changing its statistics.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.Bds5RP9grJxhZALW]{Adamantine} The stargut hydra's Strikes bypass Hardness and are treated as adamantine. The stargut hydra gains resistance 10 to physical damage (except adamantine).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.lFRU108HnGlnMwqS]{Abysium} (aura, poison) The stargut hydra emits an aura of nauseating radiation from the abysium in its body. Any creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the stargut hydra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.N4l6y6v9pKy8Nj5i]{Djezet} (magical) The stargut hydra gains a +2 status bonus to saves against magic.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5bRdhgghjtWF1Vuu]{Inubrix} The stargut hydra's Strikes ignore resistance to damage from metal armor's armor specialization effects and do not trigger the Shield Block reaction or reactions from armor property runes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.sTlptNnUX2eA0DIH]{Noqual} The stargut hydra's Strikes and abilities gain a +2 status bonus to damage against creatures with the ability to Cast a Spell.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.6Z0v9Tsthm9hyzb3]{Orichalcum} When the stargut hydra has only two heads remaining, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. It can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.SXJRjw4R8m7NPDGc]{Siccatite} After the stargut hydra takes fire damage, it becomes superheated, gaining immunity to fire and weakness 10 to cold. While superheated, cold damage can be used to cauterize a stump. After the stargut hydra takes cold damage, it becomes chilled, gaining immunity to cold and weakness 10 to fire.

LRRRKeQoeeCxpZFC.name: Hydra Regeneration
LRRRKeQoeeCxpZFC.description: The stargut hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:29] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

vFIurAInqp3GyBPZ.name: Head Regrowth
vFIurAInqp3GyBPZ.description:
A stargut hydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target acid or fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all five heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

sY0gmlsyxj94fplt.name: Reactive Heads
sY0gmlsyxj94fplt.description: A stargut hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

7Zuc7c1bOXD3I5JL.name: Vomit Meteorites
7Zuc7c1bOXD3I5JL.description: The stargut hydra lurches its entire body, spewing forth chunks of meteorite in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deal @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]). The area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, though a creature can use an Interact action to clear one square of the rubble. The stargut hydra can't Vomit Meteorites for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Vomit Meteorites]]{1d4 rounds}.

Protoceratops.name: Protoceratops
Protoceratops.description: Though it lacks the distinctive horns of its larger relative the triceratops, the protoceratops is more than capable of holding its own in combat, using its tail to knock enemies to the ground and its sturdy frill to turn away blows.

R72uRW5zGCfe84EQ.name: Defensive Posture
R72uRW5zGCfe84EQ.description: The protoceratops tucks in its head and presents its sturdy frill, granting a +1 circumstance bonus to AC adjacent allies. The protoceratops remains in its Defensive Posture until the start of its next turn, but only grants the bonus while allies remain adjacent

BNij3WTNhwLJRILS.name: Frill Block
BNij3WTNhwLJRILS.description:
Requirements The protoceratops is in its Defensive Posture

Trigger An adjacent ally would take damage from a physical attack

Effect The protoceratops partially blocks the blow with its frill, reducing the damage by 5.

Giant Fangtooth.name: Giant Fangtooth
Giant Fangtooth.description: A single bite from this creature's signature fangs can cause death by blood loss within minutes; what's worse, the giant fangtooth is willing to attack creatures far larger than itself.

cvbTdPKEcpuu4Kmf.name: Sunless Sight
cvbTdPKEcpuu4Kmf.description: In an area of bright light, the giant fangtooth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

v7zAov3bUwcF8NFP.name: Deep Puncture
v7zAov3bUwcF8NFP.description: Creatures critically hit by the fangtooth's bite take an additional 1d8 persistent bleed damage.

qoJZmD2HLQXVS5qY.name: Motion Sense
qoJZmD2HLQXVS5qY.description: A rumindrol can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

AsHXubWWh9IZnPhY.name: Dreadful Resonance
AsHXubWWh9IZnPhY.description: 60 feet. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) and take @Damage[3d8[sonic]] damage.

rtr0WHiLIFMDOLrM.name: Enthralling Call
rtr0WHiLIFMDOLrM.description: 1 mile. Each non-rumindrol creature that enters or starts its turn within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to this effect for 1 day (1 hour on a critical failure). Any creature fascinated in this way will attempt to find the source of the rumindrol's cry, mindlessly wandering towards it.

7KrYQNfJEo32CsPy.name: Entropic Cry
7KrYQNfJEo32CsPy.description:
The rumindrol focuses its sonic emanations on a creature it's aware of within the area of its enthralling call aura. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The creature becomes temporarily immune to Entropic Cry for 1 hour.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is sickened 2, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

ZJJADpm0KkKvAPWt.name: Fast Swallow
ZJJADpm0KkKvAPWt.description:
Trigger The rumindrol Grabs a creature

Effect The rumindrol uses Swallow Whole.

3K6igu8m8zgxofGA.name: Inexorable
3K6igu8m8zgxofGA.description: The rumindrol recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

2Cv5TIKMVRX9Kkh2.name: Thrash
2Cv5TIKMVRX9Kkh2.description: The rumindrol attempts individual Strikes against each creature in its reach. It can attempt up to one jaws Strike and any number of leg Strikes. Each attack counts toward the rumindrol's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Titanosaur.name: Titanosaur
Titanosaur.description: Titanosaurs are some of the largest land animals ever to walk the surface of Golarion, massive sauropods that can reach over 100 feet in length and weigh more than 80 tons. While typically content to focus on consuming vast quantities of vegetation and ignore the presence of smaller creatures, titanosaurs that feel threatened can unleash destruction rivaling natural disasters.

A2j8VSHNeAkdCLDx.name: Majestic Presence
A2j8VSHNeAkdCLDx.description:
90 feet. Creatures of Huge size or smaller that enter the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the titanosaur's Majestic Presence for 1 hour.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the titanosaur for 1 round.

Failure The creature is fascinated for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated for 1 minute.

n2Pm6UWT3TK2ss5u.name: Seismic Slam
n2Pm6UWT3TK2ss5u.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The titanosaur rears up on its hind legs before slamming its forelegs back on the ground with a thunderous crash, creating a localized tremor with the effects of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.x7SPrsRxGb2Vy2nu]{Earthquake} spell centered on itself, though the effect is non-magical. Fissures do not form under the titanosaur.

15vn04Bm1yucrFJI.name: Sweeping Tail
15vn04Bm1yucrFJI.description: The titanosaur lashes its tail in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The momentum of the titanosaur's swing then makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of its next turn.

Carnotaurus.name: Carnotaurus
Carnotaurus.description: This 2,000-pound predator lives up to its name by ramming its prey with its distinctive horns lowered, knocking them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and viciously tearing into fallen victims before they can regain their footing. Do not let its size fool you; this massive dinosaur is deceptively quick when charging a potential meal. Aggressive and highly territorial, a carnotaurus will not hesitate to hunt down and slay any creature unlucky enough to cross its path.

S8ImYw2K1hGiXLRr.name: Headbutt
S8ImYw2K1hGiXLRr.description:
Trigger A creature ends a move action within reach of the carnotaurus's horn Strike

Effect The carnotaurus makes a horn Strike against the triggering creature.

AVbQqFfDXCKjCT1Q.name: Powerful Charge
AVbQqFfDXCKjCT1Q.description: The carnotaurus lowers its horns and surges toward a foe. It Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to 2d12+9 and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if successful.

9Og1kqVtRbdxL6em.name: Vicious Mauling
9Og1kqVtRbdxL6em.description: The carnotaurus's jaws Strike deals an additional 1d8 persistent bleed damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} targets.

GOAuy9ijyEzooVLR.name: Uncanny Mimicry
GOAuy9ijyEzooVLR.description: While unable to communicate for prolonged periods, a mocking chorus can precisely imitate a humanoid voice. If a creature speaks within audible range of the mocking chorus, the mocking chorus can speak using the creature's voice, even if it says different words than what were spoken. Creatures that hear the mocking chorus speak this way can attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save to recognize the source. On a success, creatures gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against the mocking chorus' abilities for 1 minute.

LjUrbZvsKM9EoRtJ.name: Hydra Regeneration
LjUrbZvsKM9EoRtJ.description: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:43] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

ElsRoCwN3MxVJRly.name: Head Regrowth
ElsRoCwN3MxVJRly.description:
A mocking chorus ordinarily has ten heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target acid or fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all ten heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

GMRmXeCJtb4dfXpG.name: Reactive Heads
GMRmXeCJtb4dfXpG.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

LNIDuf4K5NOmol4v.name: Petty Whispers
LNIDuf4K5NOmol4v.description:
The mocking chorus adopts the voices of its enemies, spreading lies and jeers among would-be allies and tearing apart trusted friends. Creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60] of the mocking chorus must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save. The mocking chorus can't use petty whispers again for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success As failure, but the creature takes half damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[12d10[mental]] damage and is confused for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[15d10[mental]] damage and is confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

0zQsy5U0xencZHog.name: Visage Strike
0zQsy5U0xencZHog.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the mirror wolf's visages damages mirror wolf's ally

Effect The mirror wolf teleports to the visage's spot, destroying the visage, and makes a jaws Strike.

cjK0ZNEaC96yw0EV.name: Bond with Mortal
cjK0ZNEaC96yw0EV.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide spends 10 minutes to form a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 14, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane. The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunity to disease, paralysis, and poison, along with their resistance to all damage, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate amount of physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.

WCkpAIbTRQdeSQzf.name: Bonded Strike
WCkpAIbTRQdeSQzf.description:
Requirements The mirror wolf is currently Bonded with a Mortal

Effect The mirror wolf makes a jaws Strike. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to Strike the same target.

BQQ9CDsX6RwM2t04.name: Lingering Assailant
BQQ9CDsX6RwM2t04.description: The mirror wolf attacks with such speed it leaves a visage of itself behind. When the mirror wolf Strikes, they leave behind a visage in an adjacent square. The visage is treated as an ally for effects such as flanking and pack attack. A visage has AC 10 and 1 HP and lasts for 1 round.

aKe1HEWVaLLqphsT.name: Pack Attack
aKe1HEWVaLLqphsT.description: The mirror wolf's Strikes deal 1d8 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the mirror wolf's allies.

lsx9VIlR2bllPQ7r.name: Strafing Strike
lsx9VIlR2bllPQ7r.description: The mirror wolf makes a jaws Strike against a creature within range. The mirror wolf can then Stride and make a second jaws Strike against the same creature.

sfQRtdBAWJHTnJV2.name: Blood Scent
sfQRtdBAWJHTnJV2.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

tCu2c5DeVynom0WZ.name: Camouflage
tCu2c5DeVynom0WZ.description: The goblin shark's coloration blends in with the water. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check while underwater.

WpZf88V0PHKRdP5i.name: Electrolocation
WpZf88V0PHKRdP5i.description: A goblin shark can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet.

Rze7860Wtweyc3aD.name: Grasping Jaws
Rze7860Wtweyc3aD.description: Creatures that successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} from the goblin shark's jaws take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] as the shark's hold tears flesh away.

lGnm3CvnrbbSSSPA.name: Lunging Bite
lGnm3CvnrbbSSSPA.description: The goblin shark dashes forward and extends its jaws bite a creature. It swims up to 10 feet in a straight line and makes a jaws Strike with a reach of 10 feet.

Fangtooth School.name: Fangtooth School
Fangtooth School.description: The fearsome teeth of this fish are so massive that it's difficult for the creature to close its mouth. These fish must consider even much larger creatures as possible food, rising towards the surface during the darkness of night.

x3ntggdoofZDoYrp.name: Sunless Sight
x3ntggdoofZDoYrp.description: While in bright light, the fangtooth fish school is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Tz7S0kxtKVZlVZ7i.name: Bite and Gnaw
Tz7S0kxtKVZlVZ7i.description: Each enemy in the school's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save)

VQfnnoTH9xAGAEhP.name: Orescent
VQfnnoTH9xAGAEhP.description: A mjolgat can detect the ores of unrefined precious metals with its powerful nose. Common earth and stone do not impede the mjolgat from smelling ores deep within the ground.

39iIvNupxbnuXPcd.name: Head On
39iIvNupxbnuXPcd.description:
Trigger A creature the mjolgat can see targets the mjolgat with an attack

Effect The mjolgat swings its crest in the direction of the danger, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

W1s77i863STIJgAY.name: Hammerhead
W1s77i863STIJgAY.description: The mjolgat rears upon its hind leg to crush an enemy with its jagged crest of bone. The mjolgat makes a bone crest Strike; on a hit, the mjolgat deals an extra die of damage. This counts as two attacks when calculating the mjolgat's multiple attack penalty

sw6WqmhgyEp1Q7a3.name: Punch-Drunk
sw6WqmhgyEp1Q7a3.description: If the mjolgat critically fails a bone crest Strike, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

dG1p2ew8Lk4jKSYy.name: Rockbreaker
dG1p2ew8Lk4jKSYy.description: When the mjolgat deals damage to an object (such as a shield or an ore deposit), it deals double damage.

wgonJnufyL1Z1kXj.name: Shrieking Slam
wgonJnufyL1Z1kXj.description:
The mjolgat lets out a terrifying screech before bashing its head into the ground. Creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the mjolgat must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. Regardless of the result of the save, they are then immune to Shrieking Slam.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Warden of Oceans and Rivers.name: Warden of Oceans and Rivers
Warden of Oceans and Rivers.description:
A Vengeful Present

In past eras, the Warden of Oceans and Rivers was once connected to the world of landed creatures and deeply involved in their channels of commerce. Now the descendants of these creatures are unable to rely on the bounty of the sea and feel that they must take what they can to survive. Fishing folk must be swift and deliberate now that the oceans and rivers zealously protect their goods. It is for this reason not all agree with the new warden's tacticsâ€¦ and some wish to see the old ways restored.

6SRhU9G1XZkwjfMR.name: Voice of Nature
6SRhU9G1XZkwjfMR.description: Though the Wardens of the Wild do not speak in words, they can communicate complex concepts flawlessly and wordlessly with any animal, beast, plant, or other creature of the natural world through prolonged eye contact. Sapient creatures with strong ties to the natural world, such as animal instinct barbarians or druids who speak the Wildsong, can somewhat understand a Warden of the Wild, though the meaning can be vague.

qq5PhCTOiPJctZ6R.name: Warden's Crown
qq5PhCTOiPJctZ6R.description: A Warden of the Wild's horned crown commands respect from wild creatures. Wild creatures native to a warden's biome automatically improve their attitude toward it by one step (up to friendly) and typically do not take hostile actions towards each other while in the warden's presence.

n7xlpAEzqjncArlj.name: Bioluminescent Maelstrom
n7xlpAEzqjncArlj.description:
30 feet @Check[will|dc:45]

The warden's wrath conjures a dazzling storm around them that makes the area difficult terrain. Creatures that enter the storm must attempt a Will save. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to the luring visuals for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round, and for the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to move as close to the warden as possible.

Critical Failure The creature is dazzled for as long as it remains in the aura. Whenever the creature begins its turn within the aura, the creature must use the first action of its turn to move as close to the warden as possible. It can attempt a new save at the end of its turn, ending this effect on a success.

i4hk1NJdv96uNYdo.name: All Are One
i4hk1NJdv96uNYdo.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The warden attracts organisms that extend their influence. The area of bioluminescent maelstrom and the reach of their tentacle Strike increase by 10 feet for 1 minute, to a maximum of an additional 30 feet.

1YzPEJHi0V8SIf7l.name: Arctic Embrace
1YzPEJHi0V8SIf7l.description: All creatures in the warden's bioluminescent maelstrom take @Damage[10d6[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic] save). On a failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

GzGiL0g8PtgRHP2r.name: Grasp of the Deep
GzGiL0g8PtgRHP2r.description:
Creatures struck by one of the warden's tentacles gain cold weakness 10 and take a â€“2 status penalty to Fortitude saves for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HzPg4iUmO3F6tbK6]{Effect: Grasp of the Deep}

avd6lE7DXF8bpEZv.name: I Am The Tide
avd6lE7DXF8bpEZv.description: The warden creates three lines of rushing water, each @Template[line|distance:120|width:10]{10 feet wide and 120 feet long}. Creatures in the area take @Damage[18d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic] save). The warden can either push or pull, and all creatures that fail this save move up to 40 feet in the direction chosen. The warden can't use I Am The Tide again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge I Am The Tide]]{1d4 rounds}.

YuQVBiDWQJ7MDC5X.name: What Lurks Beneath
YuQVBiDWQJ7MDC5X.description: The warden attacks with their tentacles six times.

ozg3kPXCLDVX4iV0.name: Spell Reflection
ozg3kPXCLDVX4iV0.description:
Trigger An opponent casts a spell that targets the manticore and requires a saving throw

Effect The manticore gains a +4 circumstance bonus to the saving throw. If they critically succeed at the save, they can choose a creature within 30 feet that was not originally targeted by the spell. That creature becomes a new target of the spell, who must attempt its own save against the same DC.

qxNa3P8uZnbHTER0.name: Arrange Scales
qxNa3P8uZnbHTER0.description: The barded manticore flexes the muscles under their scales to temporarily gain better protection. The manticore gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and resistance 15 to their choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. These benefits last until the beginning of the manticore's next turn or they use Arrange Scales again.

RiXZj6oaa9kK9Som.name: Metallic Coating
RiXZj6oaa9kK9Som.description: A barded manticore's unarmed attacks (including spikes) count as adamantine, cold iron, dawnsilver, and silver.

xOH25nEGFaWkOOeo.name: Paired Spikes
xOH25nEGFaWkOOeo.description:
The barded manticore flings two spikes from their tail, targeting up to two creatures within 20 feet of each other. They make a separate ranged Strike against each creature, which counts as a single Strike for the barded manticore's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until they've made both Strikes. If the manticore targeted only one creature and hits, that creature takes normal damage for a single spike, but also gains weakness 15 to electricity damage until the spikes are removed with an Interact action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.nW9GbEP1NqFodqE0]{Effect: Paired Spikes}

PBbZheMzP1YRLCYf.name: Deer Empathy
PBbZheMzP1YRLCYf.description: A weremoose can communicate with deer, including moose.

eAZIsoNkpFDUXhr2.name: Cold Adaptation
eAZIsoNkpFDUXhr2.description: The weremoose treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme.

iztAc9yj0XX0NQi0.name: Change Shape
iztAc9yj0XX0NQi0.description:
Medium human with fist +11 for 1d4+6 bludgeoning,

or

Large moose with antler and hoof +11 for 1d8+6 bludgeoning.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

VVdmEh4xA1SlQGBa.name: Curse of the Weremoose
VVdmEh4xA1SlQGBa.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

Daweg1i0kaXSnpof.name: Moon Frenzy
Daweg1i0kaXSnpof.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its antlers by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

w6LNTDUzUbVxW3Rj.name: Thundering Charge
w6LNTDUzUbVxW3Rj.description: The weremoose Strides twice and then makes an antler Strike. A Medium or smaller creature damaged by this attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

LuwGMxjIRQTDlHoq.name: Transparency
LuwGMxjIRQTDlHoq.description: Unless it has fed recently, the sky fisher is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. Using non-hostile actions does not cause the sky fisher to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. When it takes a hostile action of any kind, the sky fisher is hidden instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} until the start of its next turn, as the vague outline of its many tendrils temporarily becomes faintly visible.

0qVp9z4JPMeFgkn5.name: Abduct
0qVp9z4JPMeFgkn5.description: The sky fisher reels in a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by its tentacles, pulling them into an adjacent space, and then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow them Whole} (Large, @Damage[(3d8+12)[acid]], Rupture 25). The sky fisher can only use Swallow Whole when using Abduct.

dkkw8bvkw35Kan9I.name: Enzymic Vent
dkkw8bvkw35Kan9I.description: The sky fisher vents flesh-eating enzymes into the air, dealing @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid],3d6[bleed]]{3d6 persistent acid damage and 3d6 persistent bleed damage} in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). It can't use Enzymic Vent again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Enzymic Vent]]{1d4 rounds}.

7XedHDwtFnozsLZn.name: Jet
7XedHDwtFnozsLZn.description: The sky fisher quickly expels some of its gases to move swiftly through the air, Flying up to 100 feet in a straight line; this movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Xbic0yIcsOvXhcbw.name: Sky Fisher Venom
Xbic0yIcsOvXhcbw.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and can't speak above a whisper (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and can't speak (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Chaos Falcon.name: Chaos Falcon
Chaos Falcon.description:
The extreme weather that gives birth to chaos falcons grants them a mix of abilities not found in other elemental birds. To them, lightning is as natural as fire and heat as comfortable as cold. The variability of their attacks makes them dangerous, even for the well prepared.

Like their elemental cousins, chaos falcons are often the harbingers of storms. They're also seen as omens of volcanic activity, as they will travel across great distances to play and dance in the resulting eruption. Between this association and their tendency to rain both fire and ice, their presence is considered dangerous by nearby settlements.

Fortunately, chaos falcons are solitary birds that prefer to stay away from the noise of civilization. They nest in volcanic vents or areas with geothermal activity, relying on the heat of the earth to incubate their eggs while hunting in the wilderness nearby. Unless their peace is disrupted or their safety threatened, they're unlikely to attack creatures that move through their habitat.

u06jlFoOhZZGOwBk.name: Storm Bolt
u06jlFoOhZZGOwBk.description: The chaos falcon's bolt Strike always deals the damage type of their storm nexus aura.

r4bPsbpazbrt1Ign.name: Stormsight
r4bPsbpazbrt1Ign.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair a chaos falcon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.

q7YzgrwG28M1FPS5.name: Dive-bomb
q7YzgrwG28M1FPS5.description:
Requirements The chaos falcon is Flying

Effect The chaos falcon Flies twice straight down. If they reach the ground or a similarly solid object at the end of this movement, their landing shatters that surface into sharp shards and droplets of molten stone deal @Damage[4d6[fire],3d8[piercing]]{4d6 fire and 3d8 piercing} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save) to all other creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet}.

KNTmNvXUd4b54Ezg.name: Flash Storm
KNTmNvXUd4b54Ezg.description: Water condenses around the ash particles in the chaos falcon's 15-foot aura, pelting everything beneath it with driving rain. Creatures in that area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:26] save or be pushed 20 feet down, falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if they start or end this movement on the ground.

xb2XYGog1r8YfKUi.name: Storm Nexus
xb2XYGog1r8YfKUi.description: 15 feet, @Damage[3d6[untyped]], @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save. The chaos falcon is surrounded by a cloud of volcanic ash, lightning arcing within the cloud as it glows hot in some areas and collects ice in others. A chaos falcon can change the damage type of this aura to cold, electricity, or fire as an action, which has the concentrate trait.

IWCIzZCmumm2sZDx.name: Goldsense
IWCIzZCmumm2sZDx.description: Marps can sense any accumulation of gold within range. They also can precisely measure the purity of gold by touch.

15reG9cAlQog2pqZ.name: Panicked Withdrawal
15reG9cAlQog2pqZ.description:
Trigger The marp takes damage from a melee Strike

Effect The marp drops any items held in their hands, then Climbs or Strides up to 15 feet.

cJWmuj6LPrdNdwqH.name: Gold?
cJWmuj6LPrdNdwqH.description:
The marp asks for gold from all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Each target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save or retrieve and drop gold valuables as a free action.

Critical Success The target can refuse the request, though they can also choose to willingly hand over any amount of gold. If they do so, they gain a +1 status bonus to the next saving throw they attempt within 1 minute, and they're temporarily immune to Scampering Theft for 1 minute.

Success The target can refuse the request.

Failure The target must drop coins, gold jewelry, or other objects worth 20 gp.

Critical Failure As failure, but 40 gp.

cLIy3Rb3RWeVSc8s.name: Scampering Theft
cLIy3Rb3RWeVSc8s.description:
The marp runs and attempts to snatch a purse, pendant, or other such object. The marp Strides up to their Speed, and they can move through enemy spaces during this movement. They then attempt to steal valuables from the target, who must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save.

Success The marp fails to steal anything from the target.

Failure The marp steals one object from the target's possession that is made of or contains gold. They can't steal objects held by or permanently attached to the creature. If the object contains lead, the marp drops it at the target's feet. After stealing the object (or dropping it), the marp then Strides up to their Speed.

TowRcjxa5ZN7kGUP.name: Hydra Regeneration
TowRcjxa5ZN7kGUP.description: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:39] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

2hZrkUJrzTfsUVpv.name: Prismatic Backlash
2hZrkUJrzTfsUVpv.description:
Trigger A creature successfully cauterizes one of the prismhydra's stumps

Effect The unstable prismatic energies in the prismhydra's body surge forth. Each creature adjacent to the prismhydra is exposed to its chromatic explosion.

tHcAM0IJtyMBlTXA.name: Prismatic Head Regrowth
tHcAM0IJtyMBlTXA.description:
A prismhydra ordinarily has eight heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration.

Each head requires a different type of damage to cauterize; typically, two heads each are vulnerable to acid, cold, electricity, and fire damage, but other combinations or more exotic vulnerabilities are possible. When a prismhydra successfully regrows heads, all the heads regrown have the same vulnerability, which must be the same as the vulnerability of one of the prismhydra's unsevered heads.

If all eight heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

CEXfPm5kOtVj4aSz.name: Prismhydra Heads
CEXfPm5kOtVj4aSz.description:
HP (head) 36, prismatic head regrowth

Immunities area damage

Weaknesses slashing 15

PjV6SBjIY1Ge7WUB.name: Reactive Heads
PjV6SBjIY1Ge7WUB.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

k08YNB4ccJD1Ohew.name: Chromatic Explosion
k08YNB4ccJD1Ohew.description: A prismhydra's heads are replete with arcane energy. Whenever the prismhydra successfully Strikes an opponent with its spittle, or when an opponent cauterizes one of the prismhydra's heads, the opponent takes 6d6 damage of the type matching the head's vulnerability (typically @Damage[6d6[acid]]{acid}, @Damage[6d6[cold]]{cold}, @Damage[6d6[fire]]{fire}, or @Damage[6d6[electricity]]{electricity}), with a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save.

Ghost Ape.name: Ghost Ape
Ghost Ape.description: Ghost apes are reclusive and territorial creatures that usually reveal themselves only when their homes are threatened. Most ghost apes will first attempt to use their imposing presence and natural teleportation to frighten and confuse their foes into fleeing. Ghost apes can speak but aren't particularly talkative, though they will, on rare occasions, treat with those who approach them with respect. Ghost apes can be powerful allies when motivated by a common cause, although they tend to be suspicious of outsiders, and their trust isn't easily earned.

L18NVH9z9Ly0dsnt.name: Phantom Step
L18NVH9z9Ly0dsnt.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ghost ape moves quickly, passing through the Ethereal Plane. They teleport up to a distance equal to twice their Speed within their line of sight.

aiFPTTFcVillymnM.name: Ghost Stance
aiFPTTFcVillymnM.description: The ghost ape phases partially out of existence, its form blurring and becoming difficult to pinpoint. While in this stance, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to any creature that isn't adjacent to them. They can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. They also gain resistance 5 to physical damage. If the ghost ape takes force damage, this stance ends and they can't reenter it for [[/br 1d3 #rounds]]{1d3 rounds}.

Gw0KJig6ShsLpnlP.name: Terrifying Display
Gw0KJig6ShsLpnlP.description: The ghost ape beats their chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must succeed a @Check[will|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). While a creature is frightened by this ability, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the ape. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

JFdC8WSFlIpoumiM.name: Cliff Climber
JFdC8WSFlIpoumiM.description: A stony goat can trot across the steepest cliffs. It doesn't need to attempt @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} checks to scale inclines, and it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while Climbing an incline. It ignores difficult terrain caused by rocks, rubble, and uneven ground made of earth and stone.

ymqNbLM0VaieXXow.name: Self-Petrify
ymqNbLM0VaieXXow.description:
Trigger The stony goat gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition or takes more than 8 damage in a single hit

Effect The stony goat turns to stone in self-defense. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} condition for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. If the goat is damaged while it's petrified, it immediately heals by that amount by absorbing minerals from its cud, causing its cud to lose value equal to the amount of Hit Points restored (for instance, losing 5 gp worth of value to restore 5 Hit Points); if the goat's cud is reduced to 0 gp, it has the minerals fully drained from it, and the goat won't form more cud until it has eaten a sufficient quantity of rock and slept.

CKFDEB6XiCoXc9ie.name: Overhead Leap
CKFDEB6XiCoXc9ie.description: The stony goat @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 12 feet vertically and 20 feet horizontally; this movement doesn't trigger reactions.

gtYvOmVkOoF5oQjc.name: Shove and Run
gtYvOmVkOoF5oQjc.description: The stony goat attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the nearest creature and then Strides with a +20-foot circumstance bonus to Speed.

WM49TxgFCDnEGfN0.name: Stone Bolt
WM49TxgFCDnEGfN0.description:
Trigger The stony goat loses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} condition

Effect The stony goat's first instinct is to escape. It Strides with a +20 circumstance bonus to its Speed.

sfQRtdBAWJHTnJV2.name: Blood Scent
sfQRtdBAWJHTnJV2.description: The helicoprion can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

gs4TQWASo5vkCAmm.name: Deshell
gs4TQWASo5vkCAmm.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the helicoprion's jaws

Effect The shark rips into the creature dealing @Damage[3d10[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

KaYzaXzAaFRTho3N.name: Arcanosense
KaYzaXzAaFRTho3N.description: A hexworm can sense sources of magic at the listed range as though it has a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} constant innate spell.

M8Fhux8L2hJKr1wO.name: Arcanovore
M8Fhux8L2hJKr1wO.description: A hexworm has resistance 5 against all damage caused by spells.

ssTJ7ittKqxoxFGP.name: Arcane Consumption
ssTJ7ittKqxoxFGP.description: The hexworm attempts to consume the magic of an adjacent magical effect or unattended magic item. It attempts a counteract check against the target with a +11 modifier. On a success, the magical effect ends. A magic item instead becomes a mundane item for 1 round. The hexworm gains @Damage[2d8[healing]] Hit Points.

ncx7CJVlifhStQgC.name: Arcanotaxis
ncx7CJVlifhStQgC.description:
Requirements The hexworm has detected a source of magic with its arcanosense

Trigger The hexworm's turn begins

Effect The hexworm Strides up to its Speed toward the nearest source of magic it can detect.

2EsiHAMS4PDQklhS.name: Blood Scent
2EsiHAMS4PDQklhS.description: The wereshark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

IR2MrKsw9GROfUZ6.name: Change Shape
IR2MrKsw9GROfUZ6.description:
Medium human with fist +14 for 1d4+7 bludgeoning,

or Large shark with jaws +14 for 1d12+7 piercing, no land Speed, and swim Speed 40 feet.

The wereshark doesn't have the amphibious trait in human or shark form and has the aquatic trait in shark form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

mq4nQCSaqX6TDnvU.name: Curse of the Wereshark
mq4nQCSaqX6TDnvU.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

sSN3mmNLTMy2tN16.name: Fish Fork
sSN3mmNLTMy2tN16.description:
Requirements The wereshark critically hit with a trident Strike on their most recent action this turn

Effect The wereshark digs their trident deep within their target, skewering it before taking a massive bite. The target of the Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 18) and takes @Damage[1d4[bleed]] damage, and the wereshark attempts a jaws Strike against it. The wereshark can't use their trident while they have a creature grabbed with it, but they can pull the trident free with a single action that has the manipulate trait.

Q7MJ64l6TmTh1bIA.name: Moon Frenzy
Q7MJ64l6TmTh1bIA.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

fT5rpQPJhWcOTfol.name: Deep Breath
fT5rpQPJhWcOTfol.description: A leopard seal can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

hCkw6rTwyaip2lSZ.name: Protective Blubber
hCkw6rTwyaip2lSZ.description: A leopard seal treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).

ufSDMesmDIjVUUrz.name: Whisker Sense
ufSDMesmDIjVUUrz.description: A leopard seal can use its whiskers to sense vibrations as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

MGMjpWoNmqWhhm8B.name: Predatory Slam
MGMjpWoNmqWhhm8B.description:
Requirements The leopard seal is in water

Effect The leopard seal travels up to 40 feet, ending its movement on land. Enemies adjacent to the leopard seal when it ends its movement take @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save) and are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a failure.

BzxOo51mqHtteXxe.name: Static Shock
BzxOo51mqHtteXxe.description:
Trigger A creature touches the storm snake or damages it with an unarmed melee attack or non-reach melee weapon

Effect The triggering enemy is shocked for @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save). On a failed save, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

I7QrAlBGtdUJLHWm.name: Lightning Strike
I7QrAlBGtdUJLHWm.description: The storm snake redirects the lightning it has absorbed from storms, dealing @Damage[2d10[electricity]] damage to a single target within 20 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of its next turn.

onLE1fcaDs0SR79p.name: Static Field
onLE1fcaDs0SR79p.description:
The storm snake gathers all static electricity in the area before releasing it in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that deals @Damage[3d12[electricity]] damage to all non-plant creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:19] save) and grants plant creatures 5 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute. Plant life in the area begins to grow significantly faster than the average for plants of their genus; in forests, fields, or otherwise floral locations, this immediately transforms the area into non-magical difficult terrain. The storm snake can't use Static field again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Static Field]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MGlENdqYCAwBkyXt]{Effect: Static Field}

yKi8mo3zVgSwfhPk.name: Eyespots
yKi8mo3zVgSwfhPk.description: A giant tardigrade can't see anything beyond 30 feet.

t1gkQiBthXezL85x.name: Tun State
t1gkQiBthXezL85x.description:
Trigger The tardigrade would be reduced to 0 Hit Points or would die due to starvation, suffocation, or similar environmental causes

Frequency once per week

Requirements The tardigrade isn't already in tun state

Effect The giant tardigrade doesn't die but instead remains at 1 Hit Point and curls into a dry ball, called a tun. While in this tun state, the giant tardigrade is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, doesn't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and doubles its resistance to 20. It remains in tun state indefinitely until covered in significant amounts of water, at which point it begins to rehydrate, gaining regeneration 5. The regeneration persists until it reaches maximum Hit Points. The giant tardigrade then exits its tun state.

zanTwx7iAQUEbNpS.name: Vacuum Mouth
zanTwx7iAQUEbNpS.description:
Requirements The giant tardigrade doesn't have a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The giant tardigrade draws in air with its mouth. All creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:20] must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save or be pulled adjacent to the giant tardigrade. The tardigrade chooses one creature that failed its save, Grabbing the target in its claws and making a stylet Strike.

4tYzMp9ipa1BDyJd.name: Three-Headed
4tYzMp9ipa1BDyJd.description: Any ability that would sever a greater chimera's head (such as a critical hit with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill a chimera (as long as it has at least one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using any abilities granted by the head.

9NL3lOIW0zXEJDF8.name: Multiple Reactions
9NL3lOIW0zXEJDF8.description: A greater chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

D4IuyPjtV2i0vRCR.name: Three-Headed Strike
D4IuyPjtV2i0vRCR.description: The greater chimera makes a Strike with each of its heads, each at a â€“2 penalty and targeting a different creature. These Strikes count as only one attack for the greater chimera's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks.

Majungasaurus.name: Majungasaurus
Majungasaurus.description: The majungasaurus prowls in a crouched posture, carrying its bulk so low to the ground it is eye-to-eye with its prey. Unlike most carnivorous dinosaurs, the majungasaurus is primarily an ambush predator, patiently lying in wait for quarry to come within reach before bursting from cover with a signature cry to attack.

19Hk9yB4fksq7w1P.name: Startling Roar
19Hk9yB4fksq7w1P.description: When the majungasaurus rolls initiative using Stealth, it can attempt to [[/act demoralize]] each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} as a free action. Regardless of the effect, each creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

saTF5z3Vo6RIF4hX.name: Crack Bones
saTF5z3Vo6RIF4hX.description:
Requirements The majungasaurus has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws

Effect The majungasaurus deals that creature @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save). A creature that fails this save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until it recovers to full Hit Points.

Blooming Guardian.name: Blooming Guardian
Blooming Guardian.description: The pestilent blossoms adorning the antlers of a blooming guardian are most beautiful in moonlight, when they achieve full bloom and reveal their celestial glow. When blooming guardians near the end of their life cycle, they walk one final patrol of their forest as their ancient body decomposes into the understory.

H7IQtJQD9FmQfOV2.name: Petal Form
H7IQtJQD9FmQfOV2.description: The blooming guardian can dissipate momentarily into a swirling cloud of petals and pollen to pass over brambles and slip through cracks. When Striding in woodland terrain, the blooming guardian ignores difficult terrain and can pass through obstacles so long as there is a small passageway.

TJzgGeRCww5GyIC9.name: Budding Siphon
TJzgGeRCww5GyIC9.description: 20 feet. A blooming guardian is in a constant state of decomposition; to keep this entropy at bay, the flowers that cover their antlers continually siphon life from the surrounding area. All living creatures that enter or start their turn in the emanation take @Damage[6d4[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save). At the start of their turn in any round that the blooming guardian deals damage with siphoning buds, they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, plus 2 temporary Hit Points for each creature damaged beyond the first since the blooming guardian's last turn, to a maximum of 20 temporary Hit Points.

Wmct8iyApUEKtHqw.name: Full Bloom
Wmct8iyApUEKtHqw.description: The flowers on the blooming guardian's antlers bloom, unveiling their brilliance as they eat away at their host. While in this stance, the blooming guardian's Strikes deal an additional 2d4 poison damage plus 5 persistent poison damage; on a hit, a target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. The blooming guardian takes @Damage[5[persistent,poison]] damage as long as it's in Full Bloom.

XsYwIC33w2sSqec4.name: Goring Charge
XsYwIC33w2sSqec4.description: The blooming guardian Strides twice and makes an antlers Strike after either Stride. If the Strike hits, the blooming guardian deals an extra 2d12 bludgeoning damage, and the target takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to its next Fortitude save against blossom siphon.

SFUExku7yyhLDUFH.name: Wail of the Forest
SFUExku7yyhLDUFH.description:
Requirements The blooming guardian is in Full Bloom

Effect The blooming guardian confronts their mortality, causing their flowers to burst and spray their pollen. All creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:40] take @Damage[10d10[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save. The blooming guardian then exits Full Bloom and can't enter it again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Full Bloom]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} lose that condition and increase the drained condition by the same value.

Critical Failure As failure, but double damage.

Warden of Caverns and Burrows.name: Warden of Caverns and Burrows
Warden of Caverns and Burrows.description:
The Connected Depths

As much as air currents flow through the skies, and the oceans connect the waters of world, the caverns and depths connect to each other as well, via several means. Underground flows of lava create tunnels and passages. Water's erosion also forms cave systems out of the stone.

froEwR05j1sIErDb.name: Voice of Nature
froEwR05j1sIErDb.description: Though the Wardens of the Wild do not speak in words, they can communicate complex concepts flawlessly and wordlessly with any animal, beast, plant, or other creature of the natural world through prolonged eye contact. Sapient creatures with strong ties to the natural world, such as animal instinct barbarians or druids who speak the Wildsong, can somewhat understand a Warden of the Wild, though the meaning can be vague.

M6uEBleX6mMYU242.name: Warden's Crown
M6uEBleX6mMYU242.description: A Warden of the Wild's horned crown commands respect from wild creatures. Wild creatures native to a warden's biome automatically improve their attitude toward it by one step (up to friendly) and typically do not take hostile actions towards each other while in the warden's presence.

xZpqgaOSfAIieweF.name: Magmatic Reflex
xZpqgaOSfAIieweF.description:
Trigger The warden is targeted with an attack

Effect The warden issues a spray of magma as they jump away from danger. This spray deals @Damage[6d12[fire]] damage to all adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). They then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} or Step away, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.

9y73RR8Oukdu0LR2.name: Bury Beneath Stone
9y73RR8Oukdu0LR2.description:
Requirements The warden has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The warden attempts to wedge a creature they have grabbed in their mandibles within a crack in the earth that opens beneath them. The warden attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check against the grabbed creature's Reflex DC. If they succeed, they bury the creature in the ground. The creature takes @Damage[10d10[bludgeoning]] damage. It is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 42). If the creature is still buried at the end of its turn, it takes @Damage[5d10[bludgeoning]] damage.

1R03lSgMof62gZ9x.name: Called to Depths
1R03lSgMof62gZ9x.description: The depths call to the warden, especially as they move through the air. When they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, they can use any unused movement from the Long Jump to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow}. Additionally, the warden can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, they move at their full burrow Speed.

twmWdzuIfOtysw73.name: Erupting Jump
twmWdzuIfOtysw73.description: The warden draws out a stream of lava, then jumps off the solidifying mass as it cools. The warden @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to twice their Speed. When they land, the force of the impact deals @Damage[6d12[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:15] with a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save. On a critical failure, the creature is also pushed 10 feet away from the warden.

tCBjmjZJjM3CRcp6.name: Obsidian Cage
tCBjmjZJjM3CRcp6.description: Rapidly cooling obsidian clings to the target's body and stiffens around their limbs. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} (DC 42). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for as long as they remain immobilized.

SMbxooGFfHJk1iAh.name: Vibratory Excavation
SMbxooGFfHJk1iAh.description: The warden screeches with a resonant call that tears apart earth and stone. They create a 10-foot-square, 50-foot-deep pit in earthen material or stone within 60 feet.

DbnyJTJcNZglKgOK.name: Wall Cling
DbnyJTJcNZglKgOK.description: The Warden of Caverns and Burrows clings to surfaces with their segmented feet. They do not need to use a hand to hold on to walls or ceilings.

Thruneosaurus Rex.name: Thruneosaurus Rex
Thruneosaurus Rex.description: The unholy terror known as the thruneosaurus rex is not a natural beast. They were created by Chelaxian diabolists who sought to combine the ferocity of dinosaurs with the power of Hell, infusing a clutch of tyrannosaurus rex eggs from Mediogalti Island with devil ichor and naming the monstrous hatchlings after their patrons. Although few records and fewer survivors tell exactly how the experiment went awry, the experimental subjects escaped, and their descendants are now most often sighted in the Whisperwood in eastern Cheliax.

9JFkjEnfVFnAuNdf.name: Instinctive Teleportation
9JFkjEnfVFnAuNdf.description:
Trigger The thruneosaurus takes damage from a holy effect

Effect The thruneosaurus teleports to an open space within 60 feet it can see, along with any creatures it has swallowed whole.

DWRlaBfxXrVIyZMy.name: Hellfire Blast
DWRlaBfxXrVIyZMy.description:
The thruneosaurus channels sulfurous hellfire in one of three ways. The thruneosaurus chooses the effect, but it can't make the same choice in two consecutive rounds.

  • Blistering Sun (divine, fire, unholy) The thruneosaurus ignites an orb of hellfire between its horns that radiates heat in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[2d8[persistent,fire]] damage.
  • Choking Fumes (divine, poison, unholy) The thruneosaurus exhales a @Template[cone|distance:60] of sulfurous smoke that deals @Damage[6d8[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:38|traits:divine,poison,unholy|basic] save). Creatures that fail their saves are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
  • Fiery Beam (divine, fire, unholy) A @Template[line|distance:120] of hellish flame erupts from the thruneosaurus's eyes, dealing @Damage[6d10[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|traits:divine,fire,unholy|basic] save).

BetFmirFqNcNW9mI.name: Empathic Communication
BetFmirFqNcNW9mI.description: While a shotalashu can't speak, even telepathically, it understands simple commands in the languages it knows. It returns telepathic sensations of emotion to creatures touching it or the partner of its telepathic link at any distance.

1nZ2035uetODaoFs.name: Telepathic Link
1nZ2035uetODaoFs.description: A rider who would tame a shotalashu for a mount must first form a telepathic link with it. Establishing this link require spending a week with the desired mount and succeeding at a @Check[occultism|dc:21] check. Any creature with telepathic capabilities, such as telepathy, touch telepathy, empathic sense, or the ability to cast spells such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HqTI6wRrck1YXp3F]{Telepathy}, gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. This link remains and neither can form a new link until one member dies. The shock of a partner dying leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for at least a month.

82XzBMw5oI7GUeuR.name: Jungle Stride
82XzBMw5oI7GUeuR.description: The shotalashu ignores difficult terrain due to vegetation.

niDY9lm2zgxq1GvI.name: Telepathic Pounce
niDY9lm2zgxq1GvI.description:
The shotalashu hunts by pinning its foes with its mind. One creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a â€“5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round.

Failure The creature takes a â€“10 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round. The shotalashu can then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for one round. The shotalashu can Leap.

Morthak.name: Morthak
Morthak.description:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Morthaks, being low, squat, and flat, resemble a crocodile rebuilt to dig like a mole. At home beneath vast meadows and plains, the only sign of their passing are the earthen mounds they leave behind when they emerge to hunt. Those who encounter them in the wild speak of the sub-aural rumble they produce as they disintegrate the earth with sonic blasts, a sound that's felt rather than heard.

iJajFZP5ZYRFW9er.name: Sensitive Echolocation
iJajFZP5ZYRFW9er.description: The morthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the morthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

VTKZhdASWtnV2Rf6.name: Auditory Swipe
VTKZhdASWtnV2Rf6.description:
Trigger A creature within the morthak's reach uses an auditory action

Effect The morthak makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

HPmIXM7jcjdzcyhT.name: Shattering Scrape
HPmIXM7jcjdzcyhT.description: The morthak makes a claw Strike against a creature wearing stone or metal armor. If the Strike hits and the armor's Hardness is 12 or lower, that armor is broken.

f7ggMymNLWhho7xl.name: Bond with Mortal
f7ggMymNLWhho7xl.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide spends 10 minutes to form a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 28, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane. The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunity to disease, paralysis, and poison, along with their resistance to all damage, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate amount of physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.

KVer6di68iaMUDTc.name: Bonded Strike
KVer6di68iaMUDTc.description:
Requirements The sunscale serpent is currently Bonded with a Mortal

Effect The sunscale serpent makes a jaws Strike. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to Strike the same target.

BnRSgGcCa2yWLnk6.name: Sun's Heat
BnRSgGcCa2yWLnk6.description: The sunscale serpent Flies up to its fly Speed. All creatures directly below the spaces it moves through must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save or be exposed to sun's touch poison. The serpent cannot fly further than 60 feet above the target or the poison becomes too dispersed in the fall to take effect.

Rj9yAmOBbp5iNU68.name: Sun's Touch
Rj9yAmOBbp5iNU68.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 round)

HI5afO4uknNWUqlH.name: Unleash the Sun
HI5afO4uknNWUqlH.description:
Requirements The sunscale serpent is flying

Effect The sunscale serpent Flies up to its fly Speed, then crashes to the ground, releasing a wave of heat dealing @Damage[5d10[fire]] damage to all creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:60] and searing their eyes with the erupting glory of its scales. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round, and dazzled for 1 minute.

IJhsgKvchGrIIKXn.name: Eyespots
IJhsgKvchGrIIKXn.description: A tardigrade swarm can't see anything beyond 30 feet.

AqvYv5EgeNts4Nm8.name: Tun Marbles
AqvYv5EgeNts4Nm8.description: As the tardigrade swarm is damaged, the bodies of those that enter a tun state make the ground treacherous. When the tardigrade swarm drops below 70 Hit Points, the space they occupy is considered difficult terrain.

H3F0cDhkmIXQwrao.name: Stylets
H3F0cDhkmIXQwrao.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures that fail their save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increase their drained condition by one, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Troodon.name: Troodon
Troodon.description: Troodons stand roughly 3 feet tall and twice as long, with slender necks and large, inquisitive eyes. Although they don't fully understand language, troodons have a remarkable talent for speech mimicry.

n8oCyZ449dRTuGuc.name: Mimicry
n8oCyZ449dRTuGuc.description: The troodon repeats up to twelve words it heard in the last week. If it succeeds at a @Check[deception|defense:perception] check against the listeners' Perception DC, the sound is indistinguishable from the original. The troodon can't duplicate voice-based abilities or spells, although it can mimic the verbal sounds of spellcasting.

169mTVhwXosKc4fm.name: Running Attack
169mTVhwXosKc4fm.description: The troodon Strides and makes a claw Strike at any point during that movement.

jv8ovLJKE1yASdO6.name: Wild Empathy
jv8ovLJKE1yASdO6.description: The alicorn has an empathic connection to the creatures of the natural world that.
