The alicorn can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on animals and to make very simple @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of them.

V4lzL2hQ8JPSZS3q.name: Draw in Magic
V4lzL2hQ8JPSZS3q.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the alicorn Casts a Spell

Effect The alicorn attempts to counteract the triggering spell (counteract modifier +28, counteract rank 8th). If successful, the alicorn can choose to gain the effects of the triggering spell as its sole target.

4iRClvmRfF2zlVPN.name: Aerial Attack
4iRClvmRfF2zlVPN.description: The alicorn Flies and Strikes twice with their wings at any points during their movement. Each attack counts toward the alicorn's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after they make all the attacks.

XCw63niaQc8PpjeX.name: Beam of Light
XCw63niaQc8PpjeX.description: The alicorn harnesses a powerful burning ray of light from their horn. Creatures in a @Template[line|distance:120] take @Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect] save). An unholy creature in the area takes an additional @Damage[8d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage. If the light passes through an area of magical darkness or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, the beam attempts to counteract the darkness (counteract modifier +28, counteract rank 8th). The alicorn can't use its Beam of Light again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Beam of Light]]{1d4 rounds}.

aGDOPFkZvQXyKHde.name: Ghost Touch
aGDOPFkZvQXyKHde.description: An alicorn's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

WucKQghGz6D3Wla0.name: Greater Electrolocation
WucKQghGz6D3Wla0.description: A magnetic gecko can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

ARdeJ0ZKxKc9rJd9.name: Uncanny Climber
ARdeJ0ZKxKc9rJd9.description: A magnetic gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a gecko attempts an Athletics check to Climb and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.

BXVPBRJja0TAlcDE.name: Launch Metal
BXVPBRJja0TAlcDE.description: The gecko repulses the metal attached to its body in all directions, dealing @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save) to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10]. The gecko can't use Launch Metal again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Launch Metal]]{1d4 rounds}.

fUa7SCJuCTMftahm.name: Repel
fUa7SCJuCTMftahm.description: The gecko manipulates its magnetic field to repel metal, humming audibly and gaining resistance 2 to damage from metal weapons and metal effects until the beginning of its next turn.

vcaQ5lJKm6s0xHQG.name: Static Cling
vcaQ5lJKm6s0xHQG.description: If the gecko hits Small or smaller creature with its tongue, and the target is made of metal or is wearing metallic armor, the gecko's tongue latches on to the creature. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. While the gecko is Grabbing a creature in this way, it can attempt an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC to pull the creature to a space adjacent to the gecko. A creature grabbed in this way can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} normally.

Mist Bear.name: Mist Bear
Mist Bear.description:
Like the mundane bears they resemble, a mist bear is motivated by simple pursuits, such as food. Unlike other ursines, the mist bear can dissipate into a cloud of ethereal vapor, greatly complicating the efforts of neighboring humanoids to keep their provisions safe from the creature's depredations.

Fortunately, the mist bear follows a predictable pattern of behavior, usually foraging within the Universe for only a few months every year to gorge itself. Once sated, it then enters a state similar to hibernation where it drifts through the Ethereal Plane as a cloud of intangible vapor.

nxY3HK4bvu3FTNg0.name: Mist Form
nxY3HK4bvu3FTNg0.description: Over the course of a minute, a mist bear can transmute its form into a cloud of ethereal vapor. In this state it has resistance 10 to physical damage, is immune to precision damage, and can't use any actions with the attack or manipulate trait. It has a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. The mist bear can return to solid form as a single action.

9voCXlCcCWEyNhTI.name: Clouded Charge
9voCXlCcCWEyNhTI.description: The mist bear Strides twice. During this movement, wisps of ethereal smoke trail from its body, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. The mist bear then Strikes. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack if the bear moved at least 20 feet.

1rzp0hsF26PBfH7z.name: Misty Mauling
1rzp0hsF26PBfH7z.description:
Requirements The mist bear has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mist bear digs its claws into the grabbed creature as it dissipates into mist. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[3d8[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save). The mist bear gains the benefits of its Mist Form, Flies up to 10 feet, and then returns to its solid form.

volbbhoYsX3VRgOG.name: Hydra Regeneration
volbbhoYsX3VRgOG.description:
On a failure the tyrafdir grows two illusory heads.

The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:31] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Regeneration]

IQVIxxRDsn8zGCTb.name: Deceptive Heads
IQVIxxRDsn8zGCTb.description:
A tyrafdir is cunning, if unintelligent, using illusions of regrown heads to confuse and harry opponents. When a tyrafdir fails, but does not critically fail, its Fortitude save to regrow a head, a phantasm materializes to mimic the regrowth. This creates two deceptive heads that function differently than real heads. The tyrafdir gains a deceptive jaws Strike as long as it has at least one deceptive head. Any creature that attacks a deceptive head or uses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve the illusion (@Check[will|dc:27] save).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NZ3MrmXkmfQuJp7S]{Effect: Deceptive Heads}

ePJWvJFe4lMaXPXQ.name: Deceptive Regrowth
ePJWvJFe4lMaXPXQ.description:
A tyrafdir ordinarily has six heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the tyrafdir's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A tyrafdir can regrow a severed head using Hydra Regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any fire damage or is dealt by a cold-iron weapon, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all six heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

TdIuHFKFunRMvQfU.name: Reactive Heads
TdIuHFKFunRMvQfU.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

DMOJ4yLThF6IR3o3.name: Tyrafdir Heads
DMOJ4yLThF6IR3o3.description:
HP (head) 30, deceptive regrowth

Immunities area damage

Weakness cold iron 10, slashing 10

8R6BDkL9QLaWq6eP.name: Noxious Exhalation
8R6BDkL9QLaWq6eP.description:
The tyrafdir breathes out a noxious mist from all of its mouths, spreading in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] that deals @Damage[4d10[poison]] damage to creatures within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). Any creature that fails its save must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save or gain weakness to mental 10 and a â€“1 status penalty to Will saves for 24 hours. The tyrafdir can't use Noxious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Noxious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.G1pvduwOVRz4YFUF]{Effect: Noxious Exhalation}

aIHaQWOLI7iPiMZ7.name: Hold Tight
aIHaQWOLI7iPiMZ7.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the holdfast's jaws takes damage from another creature's Strike

Effect The holdfast Constricts the creature in its jaws.

0moQPQHdnH8BplCL.name: Lithe
0moQPQHdnH8BplCL.description: A holdfast treats any tight space it can barely fit its head in or wider as difficult terrain and doesn't need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} to move through it.

g8miItlAeNmfA8N3.name: Burst from Below
g8miItlAeNmfA8N3.description: The holdfast Burrows and then Strikes. If the holdfast began this movement @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

IigZieTHo8vIeSAM.name: Crush Throat
IigZieTHo8vIeSAM.description: When a creature fails a save against the holdfast's Constrict, the creature's throat is held tight, stopping them from speaking as long as they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. This prevents the creature from casting spells with vocal incantations, as well as from using many sonic or auditory abilities.

DURQZqvnE1WhBP0b.name: Junk Nest
DURQZqvnE1WhBP0b.description: The scroungefeather's nest of sharp metallic junk covers a 15-foot-by-15-foot area. The area is difficult terrain and hazardous terrain to any non-scroungefeather creatures. A creature that moves on the ground through the nest takes @Damage[3[piercing]] damage for each square of the area it moves into. Scroungefeathers can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} at any point in the nest.

Mem6QODpIHtqr1NO.name: Tossed Scraps
Mem6QODpIHtqr1NO.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather has Grabbed Debris

Effect The scroungefeather flings the debris at a target within 20 feet, making an attack roll with a +12 modifier. On a success, the target takes @Damage[(2d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage.

P7J5DmONxucVFHWg.name: Grab Debris
P7J5DmONxucVFHWg.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather is in its nest or another environment rich with debris

Effect The scroungefeather uses an Interact action to grab an item with its beak, selected randomly; roll 1d4 to determine the type of debris. The scroungefeather gains access to the listed abilities until it uses Tossed Scraps to discard the debris or until it Releases the debris. The scroungefeather can't use its beak attack while it is using its beak to Grab Debris.

d4ItemEffect
1Armor scrapThe scroungefeather gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC.
2Shattered bladeThe scroungefeather gains a broken blade melee Strike with a +12 attack modifier that deals 2d10+6 slashing damage.
3Unexploded bombWhen the scroungefeather throws this with Tossed Scraps, all the damage is fire damage, and the bomb also deals 3 fire splash damage.
4Faulty wandThe scroungefeather gains a magic bolt ranged Strike witha +14 attack modifier that deals 2d6+6 force damage.

lWFPmS0H0zSECgmE.name: Spectral Mount
lWFPmS0H0zSECgmE.description: A pale horse can accept a corporeal rider, but such a rider is left behind if the pale horse passes through a creature or object.

Xw8tomP14n2Bj8VB.name: Aura of Despair
Xw8tomP14n2Bj8VB.description: 30 feet. A living creature that begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. A creature is temporarily immune to the aura for 1 hour if it critically succeeds.

V6SsPWfZ04OeUEDE.name: Spectral Charge
V6SsPWfZ04OeUEDE.description: The pale horse Flies twice and then makes a horn Strike. The pale horse can move through creatures.

kiI7wCXrpRbMuVx1.name: Fearless Rush
kiI7wCXrpRbMuVx1.description:
Trigger The karkadann becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}

Effect The karkadann reduces their frightened value by 1 (to a minimum of 0). The karkadann then Strides toward an enemy.

LxNxDOMQvkwRY1JC.name: Ghost Touch
LxNxDOMQvkwRY1JC.description: A karkadann's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

uMUbzmYaoWVaIbgm.name: Impaling Charge
uMUbzmYaoWVaIbgm.description: The karkadann Strides twice, then Strikes with their horn. If the Strike hits, it also deals 1d10 persistent bleed damage.

jNiNkOIBxGv7ls8D.name: Voice of Nature
jNiNkOIBxGv7ls8D.description: Though the Wardens of the Wild do not speak in words, they can communicate complex concepts flawlessly and wordlessly with any animal, beast, plant, or other creature of the natural world through prolonged eye contact. Sapient creatures with strong ties to the natural world, such as animal instinct barbarians or druids who speak the Wildsong, can somewhat understand a Warden of the Wild, though the meaning can be vague.

SqsiYSb8KFHPnGDY.name: Warden's Crown
SqsiYSb8KFHPnGDY.description: A Warden of the Wild's horned crown commands respect from wild creatures. Wild creatures native to a warden's biome automatically improve their attitude toward it by one step (up to friendly) and typically do not take hostile actions towards each other while in the warden's presence.

4hxuRQeozI2YcGao.name: Wild Trickery
4hxuRQeozI2YcGao.description:
Trigger An enemy within 60 feet targets the warden with an attack, spell, or other ability

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save. If it fails, the warden redirects the ability to target a different creature in range with a burst of mental laughter; this has no effect if there are no other eligible targets. The triggering creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours unless it critically failed.

mRMBYx28OBTaqHDC.name: Change Shape
mRMBYx28OBTaqHDC.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

The warden transforms his size to Tiny, Small, Medium, or Huge (changing his reach to 0 feet for Tiny, 5 feet for Medium or Large, and 10 feet for Huge). The warden retains his shape but can change his color to any seasonal array.

CSU1nwsLk8jcgev0.name: Forest Passage
CSU1nwsLk8jcgev0.description: The Warden of Forests and Meadows ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

q2Ut12vsCILmClE8.name: Fox's Wager
q2Ut12vsCILmClE8.description:
The warden grants a boon to a willing creature he can see other than himself, requesting that the creature promise to use the granted power to destroy or undermine the creations of civilization. The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +5 status bonus to damage against constructs, objects, and structures constructed by humanoids. It also gains a +2 status bonus to Stealth checks against humanoids. The warden can have only one wager granted at a time. The wager ends if the target is captured or dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Hc0BhuLHaldO3vqG]{Effect: Fox's Wager}

83BZB1SWTBDiRPsE.name: Idyllic Panorama
83BZB1SWTBDiRPsE.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The warden creates an area of peaceful calm. This is identical to a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} depicting a peaceful meadow or forest, except the area is a @Template[burst|distance:200].

While within the area of an Idyllic Panorama, the warden has significant control over the senses of creatures within the area and can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPXzPl7YbMEIGWfi]{Mislead} and 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{Silence} at will.

dkMORZZnD9bglG5r.name: Magical Pounce
dkMORZZnD9bglG5r.description: The warden Strides up to his Speed, Leaps up to his Speed, or casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}; at the end of that movement, the warden Strikes. If the warden began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, he remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

83Iywqe20DHfskOo.name: Sneak Attack
83Iywqe20DHfskOo.description: The warden deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Rift Chameleon.name: Rift Chameleon
Rift Chameleon.description: Rift chameleons are best known for their unsettling ability to swallow creatures significantly larger than themselves, thanks to a digestive tract that connects to its own pocket of the Ethereal Plane. When two or more rift chameleons remain in proximity for extended periods of time, their partially extradimensional nature begins to subtly warp the surrounding terrain. Direction and distance become confused to all but the lizards, making it easy for locals to get lost in places they once thought familiar.

TThoeZuLbhpozxhc.name: Extradimensional Gullet
TThoeZuLbhpozxhc.description: The rift chameleon's innards exist partially on the Ethereal Plane, allowing it to swallow any number of creatures, even ones larger than itself. Creatures that @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or cut themselves free from the chameleon's stomach reappear in the Universe adjacent to the rift chameleon's position. Creatures cannot escape from the rift chameleon's gullet using teleportation effects unless those effects can also cross planar boundaries.

4ZR4SCFbblWF8wBu.name: Flickering Dash
4ZR4SCFbblWF8wBu.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rift chameleon Strides twice. During this movement, it flits quickly between the Universe and the Ethereal Plane, gaining resistance 5 to physical damage.

7vxFfLvgqYWDkQpU.name: Ethereal Camouflage
7vxFfLvgqYWDkQpU.description: A rift chameleon can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, even if it doesn't have cover, but it cannot be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from creatures on the Ethereal Plane.

ib69NvASfvjsqsSg.name: Tongue Pull
ib69NvASfvjsqsSg.description: Any creature hit by the rift chameleon's tongue is pulled adjacent to the chameleon. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the next Strike the rift chameleon makes against it this round.

cuy3IgZ93Vnm8vNh.name: Feel No Pain
cuy3IgZ93Vnm8vNh.description:
Trigger The vibrant pup swarm is critically hit by a Strike

Effect The worker pups become insensitive to pain and leap to the front. The swarm gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round.

lezQSO0htwcgHmIZ.name: Reflective Skin
lezQSO0htwcgHmIZ.description: 10 feet. Other creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}. The aura automatically activates when the swarm is in bright light and deactivates in dim light or darkness.

q3FDvNCaWX2X7VEI.name: Focused Reflection
q3FDvNCaWX2X7VEI.description:
Requirements The vibrant pup swarm is in bright light

Effect The swarm simultaneously turns to focus the light in an arcing beam, dealing @Damage[(6d12)[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure). The swarm can't use Focused Reflection again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Focused Reflection]]{1d4 rounds}.

T2BEVw72KQFJGSNY.name: Swarming Bites
T2BEVw72KQFJGSNY.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(2d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save).

Drthak.name: Drthak
Drthak.description:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Drthaks are aquatic predators with long trailing fins that are rarely seen, clinging to coasts and estuaries where the high silt content makes them practically invisible to predators and prey alike. Some have been known to come inland, tracking their prey miles upriver before striking. The underwater environment alters the typical dischoran hunting behavior, with drthaks creating bubbles that implode to stun prey.

3cXBNyDdx24wUtWg.name: Auditory Hunter
3cXBNyDdx24wUtWg.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet uses an auditory action

Effect The drthak Strides or Swims towards the creature.

9dGAZ4GeQWPy0w5R.name: Deep Breath
9dGAZ4GeQWPy0w5R.description: The drthak can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

yes3Dw8znID2FuF6.name: Pull Under
yes3Dw8znID2FuF6.description: The drthak can Swim at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws, carrying the creature along with it.

dPYjfixt9YiqsrCS.name: Sensitive Echolocation
dPYjfixt9YiqsrCS.description: The drthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the drthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

zbH4SpmqS8avZqS2.name: Bubble Burst
zbH4SpmqS8avZqS2.description:
Requirements The drthak is underwater

Effect The drthak uses sonic power to push aside water in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], which then collapses in a crushing torrent. All creatures in the area, other than the drthak, take @Damage[3d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save).

g7fpjFdxAJa69lmZ.name: Resonant Jaws
g7fpjFdxAJa69lmZ.description: When the drthak misses a screech Strike against a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws, it deals that creature @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage.

Concert Frog.name: Concert Frog
Concert Frog.description: These massive frogs store their eggs inside their stomach. When an egg hatches, the froglet crawls its way up into its parent's mouth to add its celebratory chirps and croaks to the family's song.

8t5Ell1WdxVDU0DO.name: Conduct
8t5Ell1WdxVDU0DO.description:
One of the froglets begins to sing, granting one of three effects to the concert frog and all allies within 60 feet until the beginning of the concert frog's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.I4C55X7AzchlF9FM]{Effect: Conduct}

  • Red Grants a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.
  • Blue Grants a +1 status bonus to AC and Fortitude saving throws.
  • Yellow Allies gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional @Damage[1d4[sonic]] damage on successful melee Strikes as their attacks resonate.

vVWCORwSeynpO42i.name: Three-Frog Orchestra
vVWCORwSeynpO42i.description: The concert frog has three froglets perched behind its lips, each of a different color. A creature can specifically target a froglet. If any froglets have died, the concert frog attempts a @Check[flat|dc:11] at the end of its turn; on a success, new froglets hatch in its stomach and emerge at the concert frog's lips.

Soniphak.name: Soniphak
Soniphak.description:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Often mistaken for drakes, soniphaks glide above rocky or barren ground, picking out prey with their hearing. A hunting soniphak disables its targets with concentrated bursts of sound before snatching them up and feasting on the move. Despite being able to speak, soniphaks are no more social than other dischorans, generally responding to even the quietest attempts at communication with destructive shouting.

F3A1wbRFUhHW7CqK.name: Sensitive Echolocation
F3A1wbRFUhHW7CqK.description: The soniphak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the soniphak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

ELLDkkqDHf5Yl8lp.name: Snatch
ELLDkkqDHf5Yl8lp.description: The soniphak can Fly at half Speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claws, carrying that creature along with it.

GBUlcSToBzMlWQnF.name: Aftershock
GBUlcSToBzMlWQnF.description: Whenever a soniphak hits with a screech Strike, feedback deals each creature the soniphak has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage.

D6TybuaAzhYJfP2K.name: Disruptive Screech
D6TybuaAzhYJfP2K.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the soniphak uses an auditory action

Effect The soniphak makes a screech Strike against the triggering creature. This disrupts a triggering concentrate action if the Strike is a critical hit.

sMs1a1cLWNZ7JWYx.name: Shattering Scream
sMs1a1cLWNZ7JWYx.description: The soniphak can focus its screech at a stone or rock surface within 60 feet to create an explosion in a @Template[burst|distance:15] from the point of impact. Creatures in the area take @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain due to fragments of loose stone.

1WbksIeaf3hGSwB5.name: Echolocation
1WbksIeaf3hGSwB5.description: The stony bat can use hearing as a precise sense with the listed range.

bpzkvokQICPTqRCn.name: Petrify Body Part
bpzkvokQICPTqRCn.description:
The stony bat breathes a puff of petrifying gas onto an adjacent creature, targeting a specific body part. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be partially petrified for 1 minute, with an effect varying with the body part targeted.

  • Face The creature's face stiffens and a film of stone partially blocks its vision. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}.
  • Hand One of the creature's hands is petrified. It cannot Release items from that hand or use the hand for fine manipulation. Attack rolls with weapons held in that hand take a â€“2 status penalty.
  • Leg A patch of the creature's leg becomes inflexible and heavy. It takes a â€“10 status penalty to its Speed. If all of the creature's legs become petrified in this way, the creature's Speed is reduced down to 5 feet. At the GM's discretion, a creature with movement that doesn't rely on legs, such as creatures that Fly with wings, don't take a penalty to these other Speeds.

sI3QMH0zN2o1CNCo.name: Petrify Vapor
sI3QMH0zN2o1CNCo.description: The stony bat breathes petrifying gas in a @Template[cone|distance:15], too thin to harm creatures in the area. However, it petrifies ambient moisture, raining down a cascade of tiny stones onto any creatures in the space directly below the cone. The falling rocks deal @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic]). The stony bat can't use Petrify Vapor again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Petrify Vapor]]{1d4 rounds}.

hITWxw0rfE7Mw2zr.name: Stone Feast
hITWxw0rfE7Mw2zr.description: The stony bat specifically targets petrified body parts, which it can consume, unlike flesh. The stony bat's jaws deal an extra 1d6 damage against a creature that has been petrified, either partially or completely, and ignore the Hardness of petrified creatures.

Crying Cicada.name: Crying Cicada
Crying Cicada.description:
These small insects are a nuisance and danger to small villages within Brevoy, taking over entire forests and blending in with the foliage. Also known as calling beetles, due to their ability to mimic and repeat the voices of their previous victims, crying cicadas wait for passersby to lure into the trees, fascinating their victims with their cries before fluttering their wings to release toxic dust. Once a target is near death, crying cicadas will take flight from the trees and land on the body to feed.

The scale dust of crying cicadas can be turned into an effective ingested poison, but obtaining a cicada and harvesting these scales is so dangerous that most would-be poisoners simply die in the process. Even finding the insects is dangerous enough; crying cicadas' natural stealth and dark coloration make them difficult to locate among the trees of a forest, and following their cries often leads one to fall victim to the very creatures they're hunting.

The longer a colony of crying cicadas stays in a forest, the wider their collection of cries grows. Often, a young colony will be able to replicate only the sounds of small, dying creatures, but larger, more established colonies will have the ability to mimic the sounds of children and dragons.

p6CCIwIhLTWNlbfR.name: Steal Voice
p6CCIwIhLTWNlbfR.description:
Requirements An enemy creature has spoken since the crying cicada's last turn

Effect The crying cicada learns and mimics the sound of its opponent's voice. It can't make new sentences, but it can choose to repeat select parts of the phrases it has heard. All non-cicada creatures within 30 feet, other than the owner of the stolen voice, must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save to disbelieve the mimicry.

mjky5VTu0lNXpdL8.name: Wings Flat
mjky5VTu0lNXpdL8.description: When the crying cicada is still and perched on a tree, it blends seamlessly into the environment. It has an automatic result of 30 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as part of the tree.

YKTvAlrNoc9ohi3v.name: Crying Cicada Poison
YKTvAlrNoc9ohi3v.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus slowed 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round).

Wl43DGa4w9p8kiCY.name: Sob
Wl43DGa4w9p8kiCY.description:
The crying cicada mimics the noise of a wounded animal or crying child. Non-cicada creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:150] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be distressed by the pleas for help. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the cicada uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Sob, that creature is temporarily immune to Sob for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature believes an animal or child needs help somewhere nearby. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or move closer to the cicada as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature is adjacent to the cicada, it stays still and doesn't act.

Iv7FApuZwIfSDKZ6.name: Wing Flurry
Iv7FApuZwIfSDKZ6.description: The crying cicada beats its wings together, exposing all creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:10] to crying cicada poison.

JjJHiAGKr8tAiS9a.name: Deep Breath
JjJHiAGKr8tAiS9a.description: A harbor seal can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

nHssHIpUi4l0uxUW.name: Whisker Sense
nHssHIpUi4l0uxUW.description: A harbor seal can use its whiskers to sense vibrations as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

u1aCRdTrObUDWI2g.name: Aquatic Feast
u1aCRdTrObUDWI2g.description:
Requirements The harbor seal has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws

Effect The harbor seal Swims up to 10 feet, carrying its grabbed creature along with it dealing @Damage[1d8[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save).

Decapod Dinghy.name: Decapod Dinghy
Decapod Dinghy.description:
Decapod dinghies are massive crabs indigenous to the Okaiyo Ocean that often assist the local humanoids with transportation. They can understand Thalassic and are instantly recognizable by the colorful anemones they carry on their backs and in their front claws. Athamarus and merfolk are common sights atop decapod dinghies, lounging comfortably amidst the anemones and sharing food with their hosts.

This peaceful cooperation is indirectly caused by the legendary crustacean Tehialai-Thief-Of-Ships. Since Tehialai's rampages are a constant threat in the Okaiyo, the ancestors of the decapod dinghies bonded with other marine life to survive. Decapod dinghies' relationship with anemones is particularly tight, using the small creatures as poisonous extensions of their own bodies and using their response to movements in the water to compensate for the decapod dinghy's otherwise poor vision. In a region wracked by Tehialai's storms, everyone needs to band together, after all.

O4muO4pMRqQNB7QE.name: All Aboard
O4muO4pMRqQNB7QE.description: A decapod dinghy can carry up to 30 Bulk of creatures or unattended items on their back, such as five Medium creatures. The anemones' gentle hold on the passengers is sufficient in most situations, but while in combat, those passengers are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} if they want to take other actions while remaining on the decapod dinghy's back.

GAUIJvPlnsI5pN4c.name: Anemone Transport
GAUIJvPlnsI5pN4c.description: The decapod dinghy and all their willing passengers teleport to a patch of anemones within 10 miles large enough for the decapod dinghy to stand among them. Although the decapod dinghy doesn't need to see the location, they must have been there before. All creatures transported are temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

dd6MzxdoX8ORkN4U.name: Inflate Anemones
dd6MzxdoX8ORkN4U.description: The anemones on the decapod dinghy's back inflate, enveloping all passengers and giving each passenger a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of the decapod dinghy's next turn.

sCWcIy8BPHqQn7X0.name: Protect Passenger
sCWcIy8BPHqQn7X0.description:
Trigger An enemy within 20 feet damages one of the decapod dinghy's passengers

Effect The decapod dinghy's anemones lash out for a tentacle Strike against the triggering creature.

dpFoseZUoXpa9zMt.name: Stinging Anemones
dpFoseZUoXpa9zMt.description: The decapod dinghy's anemones sting any number of creatures they choose among passengers and those the decapod dinghy has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The stings deal @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic]). On a failed save, that creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour.

bcKDmxNVReaEpTdA.name: Arcanosense
bcKDmxNVReaEpTdA.description: A hexmoth can sense sources of magic at the listed range as though it has a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} constant innate spell.

dwWFsfMWeXI2jIJr.name: Advanced Arcanovore
dwWFsfMWeXI2jIJr.description: A hexmoth has resistance 10 against all damage caused by spells. It's immune to one type of energy it consumed most as a hexworm, typically acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic.

Ua8oTkrC5K1ndhsu.name: Arcane Consumption
Ua8oTkrC5K1ndhsu.description: The hexmoth attempts to consume the magic of an adjacent magical effect or unattended magic item. It attempts a counteract check against the target with a +16 modifier. On a success, the magical effect ends. A magic item instead becomes a mundane item for 1 round. The hexmoth gains @Damage[2d8[healing]] Hit Points.

VA9TdUI8uJQGwOOF.name: Arcanotaxis
VA9TdUI8uJQGwOOF.description:
Requirements The hexmoth has detected a source of magic with its arcanosense

Trigger The hexmoth's turn begins

Effect The hexmoth Flies or Strides up to its Speed toward the nearest source of magic it can detect.

TRsQQLZDoflPQM4T.name: Hexdust Wind
TRsQQLZDoflPQM4T.description: With a few fierce wingbeats, the hexmoth expels magical scale dust in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. This deals @Damage[10d6[untyped]] damage of the type to which the hexmoth is immune (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save). It can't use Hexdust Wind again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hexdust Wind]]{1d4 rounds}.

d99WnryfMnnDTyJi.name: Indomitable Beast
d99WnryfMnnDTyJi.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The desert manticore is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The desert manticore avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, then can make a stinger Strike against a creature in its reach.

ZCJsvwGlqNS9EnMM.name: Manticore Venom
ZCJsvwGlqNS9EnMM.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[5d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

HejwVuqegoT2EPTQ.name: Scorpion Sting
HejwVuqegoT2EPTQ.description: The desert manticore Strikes an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature with its stinger. The attack injects venom deeply, dealing an additional 4d8 poison damage and giving the target a â€“2 circumstance penalty to their initial save against the poison.

MzLzgrHdlzSOT1XI.name: Venomous Flight
MzLzgrHdlzSOT1XI.description: The desert manticore Flies twice, dripping venom from its stinger. It chooses a creature it flew directly above during the flight, which is exposed to manticore venom. The desert manticore cannot fly further than 60 feet above the target or the venom becomes too dispersed in fall to take effect.

eb5bNipVYPMkjbDH.name: Studded Cheeks
eb5bNipVYPMkjbDH.description: The cave squirrel can store up to six gems in its cheeks. It typically begins combat with all six, and it loses a gem each time it uses gem spit.

owT2QG52E3VwrS7Z.name: Defensive Scream
owT2QG52E3VwrS7Z.description:
Trigger The cave squirrel rolls initiative or has taken damage before initiative

Effect The cave squirrel lets out an ear-piercing shriek, alerting any other cave squirrels in the area to its plight. It uses Screaming Force.

sPTW134116xLKB5N.name: Concussive Gem
sPTW134116xLKB5N.description: On a critical hit on a gem spit Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Uw5Cs8JXh6arirCk.name: Forage for Gems
Uw5Cs8JXh6arirCk.description: The cave squirrel dives underground in search of gems. The cave squirrel Burrows up to its Speed. It must end its movement back on the surface. During its burrow, it happens upon [[/gmr 1d4 #Gems]] cheap gems (such as salt or quartz), which it stuffs in its cheeks, up to its maximum of 6.

ZkT9jtUw3IqD4gOk.name: Natural Speed
ZkT9jtUw3IqD4gOk.description: A cave squirrel isn't affected by difficult terrain from earth or stone.

S3o54Lnee9IO7n9L.name: Screaming Force
S3o54Lnee9IO7n9L.description: The cave squirrel lets out a terrible scream. Nonâ€“cave squirrel creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or take @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage. On a critical failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. The cave squirrel can't use Screaming Force again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Screaming Force]]{1d4 rounds}.

mpJvew306eSdx2tM.name: Crumbling Earth
mpJvew306eSdx2tM.description: The plated python lets its breath sink into the ground, transforming it to brittle stone within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. The stone is difficult terrain to all other creatures. Other creatures on the ground in this area when it transforms must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as the stone beneath them crumbles to rubble. A creature immobilized in this way can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} normally or use three total Interact actions to dig themself free.

zaf8s9pW0xZzJfak.name: Petrify Prey
zaf8s9pW0xZzJfak.description:
Requirements The plated python has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Trigger The plated python begins its turn

Effect The python's breath seeps into the grabbed creature. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature's body hardens and stiffens, causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 round and Swallowed Whole.

Critical Failure The creature is petrified permanently and Swallowed Whole.

qsKqIHUiHZAyoVOG.name: Stone Tunnel
qsKqIHUiHZAyoVOG.description: When a plated python burrows through ground, it petrifies and destroys the material in front of it, leaving a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake. A plated python doesn't need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} to pass through any space at least that wide.

OS8aeXhGNBCVVVQc.name: Swallow Whole
OS8aeXhGNBCVVVQc.description:
Large, @Damage[(3d10+5)[acid]], Rupture 20

This damage ignores the hardness of petrified creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

23PrYsW8p3mhE6Uh.name: Towering Bite
23PrYsW8p3mhE6Uh.description: The plated python lunges to its full length, making a jaws Strike with a reach of 60 feet. If the Strike hits, its target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and pulled to an empty space adjacent to the plated python. The python can attack through any material it can burrow through, leaving a stone tunnel as normal.

452LdrpT5OCYCH0j.name: Counter-Melody
452LdrpT5OCYCH0j.description:
Trigger An opponent within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Effect The virtuosic lyrebird makes a counteract check against the triggering spell ([[/r 1d20+14 #Counteract]]{+14} counteract modifier).

iQyVAyqr5ERKcsoM.name: Arcane Harmony
iQyVAyqr5ERKcsoM.description:
Effect The virtuosic lyrebird sings a subtle trill that others can use to embellish their magic. The next virtuosic lyrebird to Cast a Spell within 60 feet of the first lyrebird that used Arcane Harmony chooses one of the following two benefits, after which the Arcane Harmony ends.

  • The spell gains a +2 status bonus to damage per spell rank.
  • One target of the spell takes a â€“2 status penalty to saves against the spell.

zaQeFovenkFyl9Mp.name: Spell Mimicry
zaQeFovenkFyl9Mp.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements A creature Casts a Spell of 3rd rank or lower since the end of the virtuosic lyrebird' s last turn, and the virtuosic lyrebird heard the incantation for the spell

Effect The virtuosic lyrebird learns the spell enough to mimic and cast it this turn, using as many actions as the original spell took.

t2isDsAZlZxwt4lc.name: Spellsong Casting
t2isDsAZlZxwt4lc.description: The virtuosic lyrebird's exquisite vocal control lets it cast spells purely through its song. While it must be able to vocalize to Cast a Spell, it doesn't need to gesture, removing the manipulate trait from any spell that it casts. If it Casts a Spell with the linguistic trait (usually with its Spell Mimicry), it can Cast that Spell in Common, even though the bird doesn't truly understand the language.

AUuuQzN1AfvWUzGr.name: Deep Breath
AUuuQzN1AfvWUzGr.description: The giant coppermouth can hold its breath for 1 hour.

iX7BbgHyLmL3p3Uu.name: Greater Electrolocation
iX7BbgHyLmL3p3Uu.description: A giant coppermouth can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

j6Z028nwBjcO1Eb1.name: Coppermouth Venom
j6Z028nwBjcO1Eb1.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison],1d6[electricity]]{1d6 poison and 1d6 electricity} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison],1d6[electricity]]{2d6 poison and 1d6 electricity} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison],2d6[electricity]]{2d6 poison and 2d6 electricity} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}

VHDy7IecsO1lSpSZ.name: Quickening Jolt
VHDy7IecsO1lSpSZ.description: The coppermouth manipulates its own nervous system by increasing its reaction time, Striding and making two Strikes against different targets during the movement. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made both attacks.

sn26BFLP0AI27Z6F.name: Venomous Spit
sn26BFLP0AI27Z6F.description: The coppermouth unleashes a stream of electrified venom in a @Template[line|distance:30]. The venom deals @Damage[8d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]) and creatures that take damage from the venom are immediately exposed to coppermouth venom. The copper mouth can't use Venomous Spit again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Royal Basilisk.name: Royal Basilisk
Royal Basilisk.description: The royal basilisk is aptly named, not for only the metal crown upon its head but also for the unique potency of its poison. The creature's poison manifests as a sort of cloying vapor that sticks onto and eats away at anything it touches. Their mastery of poison does appear to come at a cost, as the royal basilisk has no ability to petrify its prey. Although the royal basilisk can painstakingly shape a crown, some made of simple iron and others of rare skymetals, they much prefer to collect crowns crafted by other creatures.

IVRkyNW8ZnlDFKUQ.name: Crowned Royalty
IVRkyNW8ZnlDFKUQ.description: The royal basilisk's crown is firmly attached to its head but can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarmed} as though it were a held item. Without a crown, the royal basilisk's mastery over poison is weakened enough that it loses its miasmatic shroud. The royal basilisk can equip a crown within its tail's reach as an Interact action. A royal basilisk's crown is normally made of iron and enables the basilisk to use miasmatic shroud, but crowns made of other, more exotic materials might confer different abilities.

fwBO7BD8je9omBHJ.name: Miasmatic Shroud
fwBO7BD8je9omBHJ.description: 15 feet. The poison in the breath of the royal basilisk makes the air around it a haze, concealing it from all creatures outside the aura, but it cannot use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. When a creature ends its turn within the aura, it is exposed to royal basilisk venom.

uvTvb2cBy4Nv0Ggv.name: Royal Basilisk Venom
uvTvb2cBy4Nv0Ggv.description:
Saving Throw DC 36

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d10[poison]], clumsy 3, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

XNwz0M9jFNsJD6gO.name: Stone-Hewing Spit
XNwz0M9jFNsJD6gO.description: The royal basilisk spits its poison with immense force, dealing @Damage[5d10[acid],5d8[piercing]]{5d10 acid and 5d8 piercing} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[line|distance:240] and exposing each creature that took damage to royal basilisk venom. The line penetrates barriers with Hardness of less than 20, ignoring any bonuses they'd provide from cover. The royal basilisk can't use Stone-Hewing Spit again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Stone-Hewing Spit]]{1d4 rounds}.

Kzg1FKJxsglkhdRO.name: Wrap in Coils
Kzg1FKJxsglkhdRO.description:
Requirements A Large or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the royal basilisk's jaws

Effect The royal basilisk moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Greater Constrict against the creature. The royal basilisk's coils can hold as many creatures as will fit in its space.

Almiraj.name: Almiraj
Almiraj.description:
An almiraj closely resembles a yellow hare in almost all ways... except for the 2-foot-long black horn jutting from its forehead. Though it shares this trait with the docile unicorn, that's where their similarities end. Almirajes are vicious creatures, known to slaughter much larger cattle and, in times of desperation, people. Its stare is said to send even the bravest warrior running for their life.

Unlike common hares, almirajes are solitary and intensely territorial. They're adaptable ambush hunters with the stamina and speed to chase down any prey. They attack with their jaws and claws but are primarily known for trying to gut their prey with a vicious stab from their horn. Many scholars believe that the terrifying magical aura the creatures exude originates from their horns. This line of thinking has led to an increase in almiraj attacks as local citizens try to capture the creature alive and remove the horn, hoping this will turn it into a more docile hare. These hopes have not proven fruitful, as an almiraj is just as aggressive, if not more so, after their horn has been removed.

Adventurers often think themselves lucky if they manage to avoid the terrifying horn of this ferocious predator, but it's a much better alternative than being caught in its jaws. Almirajes have a nasty habit of grabbing their prey and vigorously shaking them until they go limp. If this fails, they'll drag their prey underground until they suffocate deep in the earth. Few have ever escaped the burrow of an almiraj.

Yllc8kTuEZymMZNX.name: Frightful Presence
Yllc8kTuEZymMZNX.description:
5 feet @Check[will|dc:22]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence] Creatures that critically fail are also fleeing for 1 round.

glOxKwPlPrPkwFQq.name: Reactive Strike (Horn only)
glOxKwPlPrPkwFQq.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Fleeing creatures take an additional @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage. On a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

wxslfNkCD8uhnRZR.name: Final Shake
wxslfNkCD8uhnRZR.description:
Requirements The almiraj has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The almiraj clamps its jaws down on the creature and shakes it vigorously, attempting to finish it off. The creature takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. Small or smaller creatures take a â€“2 circumstance penalty to their save.

pjdVf0QiDu8QNlCa.name: Goring Charge
pjdVf0QiDu8QNlCa.description: The almiraj lowers its head and moves with ferocity toward its selected prey. The almiraj Strides twice. If it ends its movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, it makes a horn Strike against that enemy. This Strike deals an additional 1d6 persistent bleed damage.

erq7htTm9cchOw4q.name: Into the Earth
erq7htTm9cchOw4q.description:
Requirements The almiraj has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The almiraj attempts to flee with its meal, burrowing into the ground. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save or be dragged beneath the ground as the almiraj Burrows up to its Speed. If the target succeeds at its save, it Escapes and the almiraj continues burrowing as normal; if it fails, the grabbed creature must hold its breath or begin suffocating under the dirt.

Warden of Peaks and Skies.name: Warden of Peaks and Skies
Warden of Peaks and Skies.description:
Warden's Blessing

Legend says that the Warden of Peaks and Sky invites those who particularly earn their favor into their home, a nest within a hollow peak deep in the Kodar Mountains. There, the guest is treated to a grand feast, after which the warden offers to turn them into a thunderbird so they might enjoy the sky for the rest of their days, though they are not offended if anyone demurs.

4S0TKyHtVQ0rTagU.name: Stormsight
4S0TKyHtVQ0rTagU.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair the warden's vision; she ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.

5W28CDdkSL1shdR1.name: Voice of Nature
5W28CDdkSL1shdR1.description: Though the Wardens of the Wild do not speak in words, they can communicate complex concepts flawlessly and wordlessly with any animal, beast, plant, or other creature of the natural world through prolonged eye contact. Sapient creatures with strong ties to the natural world, such as animal instinct barbarians or druids who speak the Wildsong, can somewhat understand a Warden of the Wild, though the meaning can be vague.

4XFCPLuB7hfdXmDz.name: Warden's Crown
4XFCPLuB7hfdXmDz.description: A Warden of the Wild's horned crown commands respect from wild creatures. Wild creatures native to a warden's biome automatically improve their attitude toward it by one step (up to friendly) and typically do not take hostile actions towards each other while in the warden's presence.

m31f7gFeLKTcuV5I.name: Crystal Exhalation
m31f7gFeLKTcuV5I.description: The warden breathes, creating a storm of ice crystals. All creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60] take @Damage[4d8[cold],4d8[slashing]]{4d8 cold damage and 4d8 slashing damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by ice. The warden then can't use Crystal Exhalation for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crystal Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

OSyHzaEUEnuN2yN4.name: Orogenesis Dive
OSyHzaEUEnuN2yN4.description: The warden flies 240 feet upward in a straight line. As she does so, the ground in a @Template[burst|distance:30] from her starting point rises into a 120-foot-high rocky pillar topped with a mountainous peak that becomes greater difficult terrain. All other creatures in that burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} by the sudden altitude shift. The warden then flies straight downward to the center of the pillar's peak, driving her horns into the stone. As she lands, the newly formed mountains tremble. All other creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save or plummet off the peaks, falling 120 feet and landing in the nearest square outside the area. The pillar is permanent.

qOrbqjETiPFlD3bW.name: Song of the Skies
qOrbqjETiPFlD3bW.description:
The warden trills a cheerful birdsong, granting a boon to all allies within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} and evoking the freedom of flight. For the next minute, affected allies gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement}, a fly speed of 60 feet, and treat creatures on the ground as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} when they are airborne.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dZDpfgU63rXbBHpe]{Effect: Song of the Skies}

vBzwVdv5SH12bUnj.name: Tempest Downdrafts
vBzwVdv5SH12bUnj.description:
Trigger The warden Flies

Effect s The warden's flapping wings generate powerful gusts that blow smaller creatures off course. A @Template[emanation|distance:60], centered on the warden, fills with lightning-pierced winds until the beginning of the warden's next turn. Creatures must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save to take any move action within the winds; flying creatures use the outcome one degree of success worse than what they roll. Creatures who critically fail are blown 30 feet away from the warden, knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and take @Damage[4d6[electricity]] damage.

2xeHumxQDHtpQASQ.name: Flexible Dodge
2xeHumxQDHtpQASQ.description:
Requirements The hooplamander is Unfurled

Trigger The hooplamander is targeted by a Strike

Effect The hooplamander gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack and enters its Wheels Up stance.

cPjpKge1uZtIOSBa.name: Rollout Trample
cPjpKge1uZtIOSBa.description:
Requirements The hooplamander is Wheels Up

Effect As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]{Trample} (Large or smaller, ridged tail, @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]), except targets that critically fail their Reflex save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, and the hooplamander Unfurls at the end of its movement.

CIeOlhvjmGLP4p9v.name: Unfurl
CIeOlhvjmGLP4p9v.description:
Requirements The hooplamander is Wheels Up

Effect The hooplamander releases its tail, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaping} up to 20 feet as it exits its wheeled shape and unfurls to land on its four legs.

4ptp9pNHXJTjFHlT.name: Wheels Up
4ptp9pNHXJTjFHlT.description:
Requirements The hooplamander is Unfurled

Effect The hooplamander @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} and then rolls into its wheeled form. Any creature within 5 feet must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for one round. While it's Wheels Up, the hooplamander can't make Strikes and its Speed increases to 40 feet.

e1Z1NtjcYsw6wjsJ.name: Dread Gaze
e1Z1NtjcYsw6wjsJ.description:
Trigger A creature ends a move action within 30 feet of the ascendant griffon

Effect The ascendant griffon turns its head to stare down the triggering creature, and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} it. This use of Demoralize has the visual trait rather than the auditory trait, and the griffon does not take a penalty on its check for not sharing a language.

17n9uAXARDmFSevf.name: Carry Off
17n9uAXARDmFSevf.description: An ascendant griffon can Fly at full speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its talons, moving that creature along with it.

43omV52GL7Hlo6rl.name: Disembowel
43omV52GL7Hlo6rl.description:
Requirements The ascendant griffon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its talons

Effect The griffon makes a beak Strike to rip at the flesh of its prey. If the Strike hits, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or increases its drained value by 1, to a maximum of 4).

ETE17tmPQayEs1cw.name: Razor-Edged Flight
ETE17tmPQayEs1cw.description: The ascendant griffon glides violently forward, Flying twice. It makes a wing Strike at any point during the movement against up to two different targets; if either of these attacks is a critical hit, the target also takes 2d6 persistent bleed damage.

bAoiJ2oxvkDfrngf.name: Terrifying Screech
bAoiJ2oxvkDfrngf.description:
The ascendant griffon unleashes a fearsome cry that strikes terror into its prey. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Therizinosaurus.name: Therizinosaurus
Therizinosaurus.description: At first glance, the therizinosaurus, with its rotund, feathered body and bird-like beak, strikes many observers as almost comical. This impression tends to quickly fade at the sight of the creature's claws, six wicked, scythelike blades capable of disemboweling a foe with a single well-placed slash. Despite their intimidating appearance, these enormous claws are used primarily to separate tasty leaves and branches from the tops of the tall trees upon which the therizinosaurus feeds. Nonetheless, travelers through a therizinosaurus's territory are wisely advised to give the creature a wide berth, less they wind up on the wrong end of its notoriously foul temper.

fmnvGP7coWwgi0Pv.name: Stomp Pests
fmnvGP7coWwgi0Pv.description: The therizinosaurus stomps about, dealing @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save) to each adjacent creature. Large or smaller creatures who fail their save are also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

FZbkZYEUVtBk8Mcx.name: Swiping Claws
FZbkZYEUVtBk8Mcx.description: The therizinosaurus makes two claw Strikes against different targets. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but do not increase the penalty until it has made both attacks.

zSVB7lKCzd3EnT8E.name: Winnowing Claws
zSVB7lKCzd3EnT8E.description: Whenever the therizinosaurus successfully Strikes a Large or smaller creature with its claw, it pulls that creature 5 feet toward it (10 feet on a critical hit).

Apothecary Bee.name: Apothecary Bee
Apothecary Bee.description:
These giant bees feed on the nectar of medicinal herbs and magical flowers, naturally processing the liquid into syrupy-sweet potions. Depending on the precise diet of the apothecary bees, they can produce a wide variety of potions, storing any excess in the waxy cells lining their nest. Apothecary bee workers are about a foot long, with yellow and black stripes. While carrying a potion, the bee's abdomen visibly swells and often changes color to match the potion within.

The value of the apothecary bees' potions has led to numerous attempts at domestication, a dangerous, expensive dream with both high risks and high rewards. Once a magical garden has been established, apothecary beehives tend to become self-sustaining. Beekeepers can potentially guide their cultivation, but they're no longer necessary for the hive's survival. Some ancient, long-abandoned gardens still grow along the Sphinx River in Osirion, where many apothecary bees prowl for flowers that meet their standards. Upon their most recent dig to the surface, surki communities quickly began the process of "trading" with the bees, establishing habitats and using their natural magic sense to better tend the massive fields a large hive needs. Miflits, on the other hand, often end up absorbed into the bees' social structure.

The potions a hive produces vary from season to season, depending on what flowers are available. Beekeepers have made strides in creating gardens that yield specific potions and have even developed harvesting techniques that increase potion effectiveness. These techniques are valuable, closely guarded secrets, but even defective potions with cursed results have found use among the followers of Calistria and Norgorber.

njwjHnMHM7JotGBs.name: Drain Potion
njwjHnMHM7JotGBs.description:
Requirements The apothecary bee has no stored potions

Effect The apothecary bee slurps up a potion within its reach, storing it internally. A creature can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save to protect a potion in its possession.

Ux7MkNJ0woR1eBb6.name: Ingest Potion
Ux7MkNJ0woR1eBb6.description: The apothecary bee consumes the potion it has stored in its body. If the potion has the healing trait, the apothecary bee heals for the maximum amount.

VgW9B7ssvo9NV1DJ.name: Inject Potion
VgW9B7ssvo9NV1DJ.description: The apothecary bee injects its stored potion into a willing creature within its reach. This deals @Damage[1[piercing]] damage and grants the recipient the normal effects of drinking the potion.

1Xy7RCo9U1pE8GLk.name: Internal Cauldron
1Xy7RCo9U1pE8GLk.description: With an appropriate diet, an apothecary bee will create a potion of 6th level or lower every two weeks. Most often, this is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}. Each apothecary bee can store only one completed potion at a time. Unused potions can generally be harvested from an apothecary bee with a successful @Check[nature|dc:23] or @Check[survival|dc:23] check.

HiQNiL6IgNMdZtnM.name: Potionsight
HiQNiL6IgNMdZtnM.description: Apothecary bees' complex eyes let them see the auras of magical potions and instinctively identify potions of their level or lower. These auras are visible through mundane containers, though their eyes have no special ability to perceive or identify non-magical solutions, such as alchemical elixirs.

5pHmqOCEuzkoWLPd.name: Smoke Susceptibility
5pHmqOCEuzkoWLPd.description: An apothecary bee is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} if it starts its turn in heavy smoke.

Stonefish Swarm.name: Stonefish Swarm
Stonefish Swarm.description: Stonefish occasionally band together where food is abundant, filling all nooks and crannies of a coral reef. In large numbers, stonefish can take on prey much larger than themselves.

AWlVbiAbVePA0gpF.name: Defensive Spines
AWlVbiAbVePA0gpF.description: When a creature enters the stonefish swarm's space, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish swarm venom.

q8Xoe5BhuPRGZ9IQ.name: Reef Camouflage
q8Xoe5BhuPRGZ9IQ.description: Until the next time it acts, the stonefish swarm appears to be a colorful coral reef. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a reef.

30Xxn6WE11NrGrqJ.name: Inject Poison
30Xxn6WE11NrGrqJ.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are exposed to stonefish swarm venom.

jn9AnjvtJSsTXoFG.name: Stonefish Swarm Venom
jn9AnjvtJSsTXoFG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Sporeback Frog.name: Sporeback Frog
Sporeback Frog.description: This burrowing frog digs itself into moist earth so poisonous moss and toxic mushrooms can grow on its body.

uzcy9ZSDv3LL6h9o.name: Seed Spores
uzcy9ZSDv3LL6h9o.description: A creature hit by the sporeback frog's tongue Strike takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] damage as fungal spores begin to grow.

qIeDtpx57l5sc4q4.name: Soporific Spores
qIeDtpx57l5sc4q4.description: The sporeback frog shakes the plants and fungi on its back until they emit a cloud of spores in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. All creatures in the area must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure). This ability can't be used again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soporific Spores]]{1d4 rounds}.

Swordfish.name: Swordfish
Swordfish.description: Contrary to popular belief, the bill of the swordfish is not used for impaling its prey, but to stun or slash. Specialized organs help keep it warm in the coldest waters, increasing its already considerable speed and reflexes.

1tA3i1FWUctJmGlH.name: Warm Brain
1tA3i1FWUctJmGlH.description:
Requirements The swordfish is in cold water

Trigger The swordfish rolls initiative

Effect The swordfish @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swims}.

InDTSGE7SMMdWecU.name: Fast Sweep
InDTSGE7SMMdWecU.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The swordfish makes two bill Strikes against two adjacent targets, with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack rolls.

Mammoth Land Star.name: Mammoth Land Star
Mammoth Land Star.hpdetails: regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 for each missing limb); limb regrowth

oFNlkxcxCkaV0ITr.name: Regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 for each missing limb)

su08qYwM1EZB8BNV.name: Limb Regrowth
su08qYwM1EZB8BNV.description:
A healthy mammoth land star typically has five limbs. A creature can sever a limb by targeting it and dealing damage equal to the limb's Hit Points. The mammoth land star can regrow a missing limb over the course of 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Dby3ecpqPheBrgnT]{Effect: Mammoth Land Star Limbs}

PcbvgtJAmPJMUMi0.name: Regrowth
PcbvgtJAmPJMUMi0.description: Whenever a limb is severed, it must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5]. On a success, the limb will slowly begin to grow into a new mammoth land star over the course of a week, unless it is doused in acid or fire.

5g4IJLaMtEhPW6ra.name: Detach
5g4IJLaMtEhPW6ra.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star falls below half its total Hit Points

Effect The mammoth land star severs one of its own limbs as a distraction, then Strides three times. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

fTN4TsTSO1TZ0TDT.name: Digest
fTN4TsTSO1TZ0TDT.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star has a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mammoth land star extrudes its stomach onto its prey and digests it alive. The target takes @Damage[(2d12+6)[acid]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

CD5zD0yBK4gwgKyE.name: Glide
CD5zD0yBK4gwgKyE.description: The land star blows air through its feet to hover 1 foot in the air and Strides twice with a +5-foot circumstance bonus to Speed, ignoring uneven ground and difficult terrain below it.

qBZJ1ZbM6jBcfV4L.name: Pry
qBZJ1ZbM6jBcfV4L.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star has a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} that is wearing armor

Effect The mammoth land star makes a feet Strike against a creature it has grabbed. If that Strike hits and the creature is wearing armor with Hardness 12 or lower, the armor is broken. This Strike doesn't further damage armor that's already broken.

9WlgMEC7dF3Vx1de.name: Spiny Venom
9WlgMEC7dF3Vx1de.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}

48vLPMzxvUYMyMDf.name: Deep Breath
48vLPMzxvUYMyMDf.description: The lightning turtle can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

36l8JVIqqAV4edmp.name: Greater Electrolocation
36l8JVIqqAV4edmp.description: A lightning turtle can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

yNQF1eVE0WPEHDOz.name: Shell Shock
yNQF1eVE0WPEHDOz.description:
Trigger A lightning turtle is hit by a melee or an unarmed attack

Effect The lightning turtle releases some of its stored electrical power, inflicting @Damage[7d6[electricity]] damage to the creature attacking it.

beRBWWg6xwZiT840.name: Healing Pulse
beRBWWg6xwZiT840.description: The lightning turtle releases a pulse of low-intensity electricity from its body to promote healing. This restores @Damage[5d8[healing]] Hit Points to the turtle and each living ally within 10 feet, including creatures normally immune to electricity. The turtle can't use Healing Pulse again for 1 minute and is temporarily immune to the Healing Pulse of any lightning turtle for 1 minute.

auQMbsuySkuEV640.name: Sparking Shell
auQMbsuySkuEV640.description: The lightning turtle withdraws into its shell. This increases its AC to 36, but it can't act except to use Shell Shock or reemerge as a single action. While in its shell, the turtle's Shell Shock deals another 4d6 damage and loses the nonlethal trait.
